Quote: The greatest discovery of my generation is that human beings can alter their lives by altering their attitudes of mind. You can actually remake your life.
Author: William James

Quote: I never met a man I didn't like.
Author: Will Rogers

Quote: Beware of what you want for you will get it.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: A man is what he thinks about all day long.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: They conquer who believe they can. Do the thing you fear and death of fear is certain.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The best medicine for a man is to get an ax and chop wood until physically tired.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Master faith and you will automatically master fear.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Most people are holdouts, that is to say, they are always keeping something in reserve. They do not invest themselves 100 percent in competition. Because of that fact they never achieve the highest of which they are capable.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Expecting the best means that you put your whole heart into what you want to accomplish. People are defeated in life not because of lack of ability, but for lack of wholeheartedness. They do not wholeheartedly expect to succeed. Their heart isn't in it, which is to say they themselves are not fully given. Results do not yield themselves to the person who refuses to give himself to the desired results.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: God runs a beauty parlor.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: It is not necessary to allow your spirit to sag or grow stale or dull. Prayer can freshen you up every evening and send you out renewed each morning. Prayer driven deeply into your subconscious can remake you. It releases and keeps power flowing freely.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: You can't get a man physically healthy until you get him spiritually healthy.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Many people are tired simply because they are not interested in anything. The surest way not to become tired is to lose yourself in something in which you have a profound conviction.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Everyone should insist upon not less than a quarter of an hour of absolute quiet every twenty-four hours. Go alone into the quietest place available to you and sit for fifteen minutes and practice the art of silence. Do not write. Do not read. Think as little as possible. Throw your mind into neutral.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Let nothing disturb you. Let nothing frighten you. Everything passes away except God. God alone is sufficient.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Feelings of confidence depend upon the type of thoughts that habitually occupy your mind. Think defeat and you are bound to feel defeated. But practice thinking confident thoughts, make it a dominating habit, and you will develop such a strong sense of capacity that regardless of what difficulties arise you will be able to overcome them.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: The trouble with lots of prayers is that they don't have any suction. Drive your prayers deep into your doubts, fears, inferiorities. Pray deep, big prayers that have plenty of suction and you will come up with powerful and vital faith.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: The greatest secret for eliminating the inferiority complex, which is another term for deep and profound self-doubt, is to fill your mind to overflowing with faith. Develop a tremendous faith in God and that will give you a humble yet soundly realistic faith in yourself.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Whomever you help to build up and become a better, stronger, finer person will give you his undying devotion. Build up as many people as you can. Do it unselfishly. Do it because you like them and because you see possibilities in them. Do this and you will never lack for friends. You will always be well thought of. Build people up and love them genuinely. Do them good and their esteem and affection will flow back toward you.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: There is a deep tendency in human nature to become precisely like that which you habitually imagine yourself to be.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Throw your heart over the bar and your body will follow.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Personally, I believe that prayer is a sending out of vibrations from one person to another and to God. All of the universe is in vibration. When you send out a prayer for another person, you employ the force inherent in a spiritual universe. You transport from yourself to the other person a sense of love, helpfulness, support--a sympathetic, powerful understanding--and in this process you awaken the vibrations in the universe through which God brings to pass the objectives prayed for.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: The conservation of energy depends on getting your personality speed synchronized with the rate of God's movement. God is in you. If you are going at one rate and God at another, you are tearing yourself apart. When we become attuned to God's rhythm, we develop a normal tempo within ourselves and energy flows freely.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Attitudes are more important than facts.
Author: Karl Menninger

Quote: When responding to ethical dilemmas or social politics, you need a morality framework.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: If you want your kids to learn about the physical world, let them play with cups and water; don't lecture them about the conservation of volume. If you want your kids to learn about the social world, let them play with other kids and resolve disputes; don't lecture them about the Ten Commandments. And for heaven's sake, don't force them to obey God or you. That will only freeze their development.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: If there is any one secret of success it lies in the ability to get the other person's point of view and see things from their angle as well as your own.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: If you want to change someone's mind then you've got to talk to their elephants. Avoid direct confrontations or combative reasoning. Your goal should be to convey respect, warmth, and openness to dialogue before stating your case.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: Moral reasons are the tail wagged by the intuitive dog.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: When we see or hear things other people do, the elephant begins to lean immediately and the rider begins looking around for a way to support each move.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: Reason is not fit to rule. It was designed to seek justification, not truth. Anyone who values truth should stop worshipping reason.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: The ethics of divinity: 'people are children of God and should behave accordingly. There are certain actions that degrade the man, dishonors his creator, and violates the sacred order of the universe.'
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: The conservative advantage is that republicans understand how to appeal to moral psychology and democrats don't. Democrats offer just sugar (care) and salt (fairness) whereas Republicans appeal to all five taste receptors: care, fairness, loyalty, authority, sanctity.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: Yin and yang is a key to respecting and appreciating the other side. Both liberals and conservatives help balance the system and both are necessary.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote:
An organization that takes advantage of our hivish nature can activate pride, loyalty, and enthusiasm among its employees and then monitor them less closely. To turn on the hive switch:
 
 - Increase similarity, not diversity
 - Exploit synchrony
 - Create healthy competition among teams, not individuals
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: Turn their gaze away from Him towards themselves. Keep them watching their own minds and trying to produce feelings there by the action of their own wills. Teach them to estimate the value of each prayer by their success in producing the desired feeling.
Author: Screwtape (C.S. Lewis)

Quote: It's funny how mortals always picture us putting things into their minds: in reality our best work is done by keeping things out.
Author: Screwtape (C.S. Lewis)

Quote: We are not human beings having a spiritual experience. We are spiritual beings having a human experience.
Author: Teilhard de Chardin
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: There's no better way to inform and expand your mind on a regular basis than to get into the habit of reading good literature.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: There are times when transformation requires no outside counsel. Often when people are really given the chance to open up, they unravel their own problems and the solutions become clear to them in the process. At other times, they really need additional perspective and help. The key is to genuinely seek the welfare of the individual, to listen with empathy, to let the person get to the problem and the solution at his own pace and time. Layer upon layer--it's like peeling an onion until you get to the soft inner core.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: What a difference real understanding can make! All the well-meaning advice in the world won't amount to a hill of beans if we're not even addressing the real problem. And we'll never get to the problem if we're so caught up in our own autobiography, our own paradigms, that we don't take off our glasses long enough to see the world from another point of view.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: Next to physical survival, the greatest need of a human being is psychological survival--to be understood, to be affirmed, to be validated, to be appreciated. When you listen with empathy to another person, you give that person psychological air. And after that vital need is met, you can then focus on influencing or problem solving.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: You can't be successful with other people if you haven't paid the price of success with yourself.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: You simply can't think efficiency with people. You think effectiveness with people and efficiency with things.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: The key is not to prioritize what's on your schedule, but to schedule your priorities.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: Almost all of the world-class athletes and other peak performers are visualizers. They see it; they feel it; they experience it before they actually do it.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: Although the church claims to teach people about the source of power, it does not claim to be that power itself. It claims to be one vehicle through which divine power can be channeled into man's nature.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: Listen twice as much as you speak.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: Real success is success with self. It's not in having things, but in having mastery, having victory over self.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: How different our lives are when we really know what is deeply important to us, and, keeping that picture in mind, we manage ourselves each day to be and to do what really matters most.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: My experience has been that there are times to teach and times not to teach. When relationships are strained and the air charged with emotion, an attempt to teach is often perceived as a form of judgment and rejection. But to take the person alone, quietly, when the relationship is good and to discuss the teaching or the value seems to have much greater impact.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: If you don't let a teacher know at what level you are--by asking a question or revealing your ignorance--you will not learn or grow.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: In emphatic listening, you listen with your ears, but you also, and more importantly, listen with your eyes and with your heart. You listen for feeling, for meaning. You listen for behavior. You use your right brain as well as your left. You sense, you intuit, you feel.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: We typically seek first to be understood. Most people do not listen with the intent to understand; they listen with the intent to reply. They're either speaking or preparing to speak. They're filtering everything through their own paradigms, reading their autobiography into other people's lives.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: The real key to your influence with me is your example, your actual conduct. Your character is constantly radiating, communicating.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: We have such a tendency to rush in, to fix things up with good advice. But we often fail to take the time to diagnose, to really, deeply understand the problem first. If I were to summarize in one sentence the single most important principle I have learned in the field of interpersonal relations, it would be this: Seek first to understand, then to be understood.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: One of the most important ways to manifest integrity is to be loyal to those who are not present. In doing so, we build the trust of those who are present. When you defend those who are absent, you retain the trust of those present.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: If you want to get something done, give it to a busy man.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: Between stimulus and response, man had the freedom to choose.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: We see the world, not as it is, but as we are conditioned to see it. When other people disagree with us, we immediately think something is wrong with them. But clearheaded people see things differently, each looking through the unique lens of experience.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: That which we persist in doing becomes easier--not that the nature of the task has changed, but our ability to do has increased.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: What you are shouts so loudly in my ears I cannot hear what you say.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: Service is the rent we pay for the privilege of living on this earth.
Author: N. Eldon Tanner
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: Maturity is the balance between courage and consideration. It is the ability to express one's own feelings and convictions balanced with consideration for the thoughts and feelings of others.
Author: Hrand Saxenian
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: I know of no more encouraging fact than the unquestionable ability of man to elevate his life by conscious endeavor.
Author: Henry David Thoreau
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: The Lord works from the inside out. The world works from the outside in. The world would take people out of the slums. Christ takes the slums out of people, and then they take themselves out of the slums. The world would mold men by changing their environment. Christ changes men, who then change their environment. The world would shape human behavior, but Christ can change human nature.
Author: Ezra Taft Benson
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: The successful person has the habit of doing the things failures don't like to do. They don't like doing them either necessarily. But their disliking is subordinated to the strength of their purpose.
Author: E. M. Gray
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: It is more noble to give yourself completely to one individual than to labor diligently for the salvation of the masses.
Author: Dag Hammarskjold
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: It is impossible to for us to break the law. We can only break ourselves against the law.
Author: Cecil B. DeMille
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: Whenever my version is different from somebody else's, use the less flattering version.
Author: Warren Buffet

Quote: In the short run the market is a voting machine. In the long run, it's a weighing machine.
Author: Warren Buffet

Quote: Prayer needs no speech. It springs from the heart. Such worship or prayer is no flight of eloquence; it is no lip-homage. It must be combined with the utmost humility.
Author: Gandhi
Source: The Story of My Experiments with Truth: An Autobiography

Quote: If one ponders on objects of the sense, there springs attraction; from attraction grows desire, desire to flames to fierce passion, passion breeds recklessness; then the memory--all betrayed--lets noble purpose go, and saps the mind, till purpose, mind and man are all undone.
Author: Gandhi
Source: The Story of My Experiments with Truth: An Autobiography

Quote: I must say that my constitutional shyness has been no disadvantage whatsoever. In fact I can see that, on the contrary, it has been all to my advantage. Experience has taught me that silence is a part of the spiritual discipline of a votary of truth.
Author: Gandhi
Source: The Story of My Experiments with Truth: An Autobiography

Quote: Many experiments taught me that the real seat of taste was not the tongue but the mind.
Author: Gandhi
Source: The Story of My Experiments with Truth: An Autobiography

Quote: One thing took deep root in me--the conviction that morality is the basis of things, and that truth is the substance of morality. Truth became my sole objective. It began to grow in magnitude every day, and my definition of it also has been ever widening.
Author: Gandhi
Source: The Story of My Experiments with Truth: An Autobiography

Quote: Lying to anyone was out of the question. It was this last thing that saved me from many a pitfall.
Author: Gandhi
Source: The Story of My Experiments with Truth: An Autobiography

Quote: The seeker after truth should be humbler than the dust. The world crushes the dust under its feet, but the seeker after truth should so humble himself that even the dust could crush him. Only then, and not till then, will he have a glimpse of truth.
Author: Gandhi
Source: The Story of My Experiments with Truth: An Autobiography

Quote: The essence of religion is morality.
Author: Gandhi
Source: The Story of My Experiments with Truth: An Autobiography

Quote: Meditation is not about getting rid of all your thoughts; it's learning not to get so lost in them that you forget what your goal is.
Author: Kelly McGonigal

Quote: This is what defines a willpower challenge: Part of you wants one thing, and another part of you wants something else. Or your present self wants one thing, but your future self would be better off if you did something else. When these two selves disagree, one version of us has to override the other. The part of you that wants to give in isn't bad--it simply has a different point of view on what matters most.
Author: Kelly McGonigal

Quote: Prospective employers don't like unfocused and complacent candidates; they want to believe that you've been preparing to work for them forever.
Author: Alexandra Levit
Source: They Don't Teach Corporate in College

Quote: Difficult as it may be, you must change your attitude about the education you left behind. A college degree is a piece of paper that gets you in the door for an interview--it may even land you a job. But if you want to get any further in the corporate world, you have to treat your first job out of college like it's 1st grade.
Author: Alexandra Levit
Source: They Don't Teach Corporate in College

Quote: It is a well known fact that one comes finally to believe whatever one repeats to one's self. Every man is what he is because of the dominating thoughts which he permits to occupy his mind.
Author: Napolean Hill

Quote: I had learned from years of experience with men, that when a man really desires a thing so deeply that he is willing to stake his entire future on a single turn of the wheel in order to get it, he is sure to win.
Author: Napolean Hill

Quote: When defeat overtakes a man, the easiest and most logical thing to do is to quit. That is exactly what the majority of men do.
Author: Napolean Hill

Quote: You may as well know that every great leader, from the dawn of civilization down to the present, was a dreamer.
Author: Napolean Hill

Quote: Every adversity brings with it the seed of an equivalent advantage.
Author: Napolean Hill

Quote: All achievement, no matter what may be its nature, must begin with an intense, burning desire for something definite.
Author: Napolean Hill

Quote: Genuine wisdom is usually cospicuous through modesty and silence.
Author: Napolean Hill

Quote: My experience has taught me that the next best thing to being truly great, is to emulate the great, by feeling and action, as nearly as possible.
Author: Napolean Hill

Quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Why should we be in such desparate haste to succeed and in such desparate enterprises? If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music which he hears, however measured or far away.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Our life is frittered away by detail. Simplicity, simplicity, simplicity!
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived. I wanted to live deep and suck out all the marrow of life.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Man should not play life, or study it merely, while the community supports him at this expensive game, but earnestly live it from beginning to end.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Being right in the end isn't really what matters. Copernicus was wrong, and Newton was wrong, and Franklin was wrong. Nonetheless, they all made incredibly important contributions to our understanding of the world around us. We could hardly have the understanding we do today of cosmology, gravity, or electricity without their work.
Author: Richard Heck

Quote: Philosophers disagree about this, but I do think there is such a thing as absolute truth. We need to distinguish the question of truth from the question of knowledge. It may well be there is no such thing as 'absolutely certain knowledge,' something we believe to be true and that we couldn't possibly be wrong about. But whether we can know an absolute truth for certain or not, there could be such truth.
Author: Peter Lipton

Quote: How could an all-powerful, perfectly good Being permit suffering to occur? The answer is pretty simple. All that must be done is to deny that suffering is a bad thing. This can be done in a number of ways: One can argue, for example, that we only regard sufferring as bad because we fail to understand God's larger purpose in allowing suffering--perhaps, it's actually good, because it leads to greater wisdom or character than we'd obtain otherwise.
Author: Louise Antony

Quote: Mindfulness means paying attention in a particular way: on purpose, in the present moement, and nonjudgmentally.
Author: Jon Kabat-Zinn
Source: Wherever You Go, There You Are

Quote: Meditation is about not trying to improve yourself or get anywhere else, but simply to realize where you already are.
Author: Jon Kabat-Zinn
Source: Wherever You Go, There You Are

Quote: All of Walden pond is within your breath.
Author: Jon Kabat-Zinn
Source: Wherever You Go, There You Are

Quote: True leaders are hardly known to their followers. When the work is done right, with no fuss or boasting, ordinary people say, 'oh, we did it'.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: To be a true leader in your own life, and in the lives of others, practice resisting the need to be recognized.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: Gently smile at your ego's desire to take credit and silently acknowledge your true leadership when others feel they accomplished the task themselves.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote:
Cicero's Six Mistakes of Man:
 
 - The illusion that personal gain is made up of crushing others.
 - The tendency to worry about things that cannot be changed or corrected.
 - Insisting that a thing is impossible because we cannot accomplish it.
 - Refusing to set aside trivial preferences.
 - Neglecting development and refinement of the mind, and not acquiring the habit of reading and study.
 - Attempting to compel others to believe and live as we do.
Author: Cicero

Quote: Your life is like a boat, cruising through life. The wake is a trail of water left behind and nothing more. The engine is the present moment and powers the boat forward. It is impossible for the wake to drive the boat.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: One of life's greatest illusions is the belief that the past is responsible for the current conditions of our lives.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: The most important point is to own your physical body. If you slump, you will lose yourself.
Author: Shunryu Suzuki

Quote: When we inhale, the air comes into the inner world. When we exhale, the air goes out to the outer world. The inner world is limitless, and the outer world is also limitless. Our throat is like a swinging door.
Author: Shunryu Suzuki

Quote: Because we enjoy all apsects of life as an unfolding of big mind, we do not care for any excessive joy. So we have imperturbable composure.
Author: Shunryu Suzuki

Quote: To stop your mind does not mean to stop the activities of mind. It means your mind pervades your whole body.
Author: Shunryu Suzuki

Quote: When you sit, you should just sit; when you eat you should just eat.
Author: Shunryu Suzuki

Quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
Author: Gandhi

Quote: Businesses thrive on agility, speed, passion, and alignment
Author: Forbes

Quote: The most important single ingredient for success is knowing how to get along with people.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: I don’t want you to spend the rest of your life being average at what you are bad at. I want you to become great at what you are good at.
Author: Roy Spence

Quote: A prophet does not stand between you and the Savior. Rather, he stands beside you and points the way to the Savior
Author: Neil Anderson

Quote: If grass were to stiffen tall in an attempt to resist the strong winds, it would likely break in two. Be as free as the grass and flow with acceptance.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: What seems but trivial conversation to you may be of great importance to another.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Optimism isn't a futuristic expectation that things will get better; it is embracing the present moment and loving what is.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Arrogance may cause you to appear more charismatic but it doesn't inspire trust.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: A life of too much ease and too much freedom will likely be reminisced with feelings of emptiness. Sacrifice and suffering give our lives substance.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: It is futile for a man to spend his days trying to find himself. If man's core is love, he will never truly find himself by looking inside himself. Love can only be actualized by giving it to another first.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: You can display all the confidence in the world without coming across as prideful if you make sure to show an equal amount of willingness and desire to learn from others.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Desiring to become a person of virtue tends to be a better motivator than trying to overcome your vices. As it goes, turning on the light is more effective than trying to push the darkness out.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Far too many fall into normalacy by forfeiting their independence of mind too soon. They let their church, their friends, and society mold them before ever finding out who they really are. Those who are great are not creations of others--they have created themselves.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Independent soul searching is prerequisite to passionate selfless ministry.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Before you can figuratively step into someone else's shoes, you must fully step out of your own. You can't experience true empathy if you are being biased by your own opinions and experience.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Someone who stops speaking is not necessarily done talking. Interrupting a person's train of thought is just as rude as interrupting their voice.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: We must develop the capacity to see men not as they are at present but as they may become.
Author: Thomas S. Monson

Quote: Forgiveness comes from some other place. It's not something that we manufacture. We can create the conditions under which forgiveness can appear an we hope it will appear, but we can't control true forgiveness.
Author: Thomas Moore

Quote: Grant me the strength to accept things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.
Author: St. Francis

Quote: There is only one good, knowledge; there is only one evil, ignorance.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The true intellectual is one whose intellect is sufficiently developed that he recognizes not only the great potential, but also the limitations of his intellectual capacity. The most learned people are those who find no inconsistency between study and faith and who have achieved proficiency in both.
Author: Rex E. Lee

Quote: Man has within him an inherent love of virtue and duty. To be sure, a man seeks some of the advantages of virtue. But one of the advantages of virtue is that it makes the soul superior to what an evil man calls advantages, and fills the heart with the love of God's law. There is no elevated mind that does not feel that virtue is it's own reward.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: To be sure, a man seeks some of the advantages of virtue. But one of the advantages of virtue is that it makes the soul superior to what an evil man calls advantages, and fills the heart with the love of God's law.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Loneliness is a time when we feel separate from all. Solitude is a time when we feel deeply connected to self
Author: Psychology Today

Quote: Truly happy people seem to have an intuitive grasp of the fact that sustained happiness is not just about doing things that you like. Happy people, are, simply put, curious.
Author: Psychology Today

Quote: If you want to come up with a creative solution, you need to think about the problem in a new way. Don't focus on finding a creative solution, look for another way to describe the situation.
Author: Psychology Today

Quote: Battling boredom thwarts serendipity. 'Wasted' moments are the ones in which we often unconsciously connect the dots. The value of unfilled time is one many must work to appreciate.
Author: Psychology Today

Quote: What we do in life echoes in the eternities.
Author: Maximus

Quote: We must rapidly begin the shift from a 'thing-oriented' society to a 'person-oriented' society.
Author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

Quote: Never ruin an apology with an excuse.
Author: Kimberly Johnson

Quote: We often talk about people with great memories as if they have a gift -- but that is not the case. We remember, when we pay attention. We remember, when we are deeply engaged. We remember, when we are able to take information and to figure out why it is meaningful to us.
Author: Joshua Foer

Quote: The four cardinal virtues are prudence, justice, fortitude, and temperance. The three theological virtues are faith, hope, and love.
Author: Joseph Pieper

Quote: The seven deadly sins are lust, gluttony, greed, sloth, wrath, envy, and pride.
Author: Joseph Pieper

Quote: When truth shall touch the cords of your heart, they will vibrate; then intelligence shall illuminate your mind, and shed its luster in your soul, and you shall begin to understand the things you once knew, but which had gone from you; you shall begin to understand and know the object of your creation.
Author: John Taylor

Quote: Those who are average look to stay in their comfort zone. Those who are great look to get out of their comfort zone.
Author: Jeff Pickett

Quote: To be a man, a boy must see a man.
Author: J R Moehringer

Quote: I had no shoes and complained, until I met a man who had no feet.
Author: Indian Proverb

Quote: God loves us more than he loves our happiness.
Author: Gordon B. Hinckley

Quote: In the moment when I truly understand my enemy, understand him well enough to defeat him, then in that very moment I also love him. I think it's impossible to really understand somebody, what they want, what they believe, and not love them the way they love themselves.
Author: Ender Wiggin

Quote: The world needs more inspiration and less information.
Author: Elain Witt

Quote: Reading without reflection is like eating without digestion.
Author: Edmund Burke

Quote: A belief may be comforting. Only through your own experience, however, does it become liberating.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Most of what people have to say about God and the higher spiritual worlds has involved bringing them down to our level, rather than elevating our perceptions up to theirs.
Author: Eben Alexander

Quote: Expecting the world to treat you fairly because you are a good person is a little like expecting a bull not to charge at you because you are a vegetarian.
Author: David Wholey

Quote: Looking at small advantages prevents great affairs from being accomplished.
Author: Confucius

Quote: The hearing that is only in the ears is one thing. The hearing in the mind is another. But the hearing of the spirit is not limited to any one faculty, to the ear, or to the mind. Hence it demands the emptiness of all the faculties. And when the faculties are empty, then the whole being listens. There is then a direct grasp of what is right there before you that can never be heard with the ear or understood with the mind.
Author: Chuang-Tzu

Quote: It is it is Christ himself, not the Bible, who is the true word of God. The Bible, read in the right spirit and with the guidance of good teachers, will bring us to Him.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: The pain I feel now is the happiness I felt before.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: All you then have to do is to keep out of his mind the question ""If I, being what I am, can consider that I am in some sense a Christian, why should the different vices of those people in the next pew prove that their religion is mere hypocrisy and convention?
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: True humility is not thinking less of yourself; it is thinking less about yourself.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: I believe in Christianity as I believe the sun had risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Emotions cycle in and cycle out. The key is to embrace them, but not attach to them. Verbally acknowledge them. Say, this is what anger feels like, this is what sadness feels like, this is what love and happiness feels like.
Author: Buddhist Podcast

Quote: All that we are is the result of what we have thought.
Author: Buddha

Quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one getting burned.
Author: Buddha

Quote: Religion has gone from a belief of faith and mystery to certainty. I'm right you're wrong -- shut up.
Author: Brene Brown

Quote: Don't fake it till you make it. Fake it till you become it.
Author: Amy Cuddy

Quote: I do not like that man. I must get to know him better.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: I have never had hunger pains sated by a complaint.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: When we choose not to do something we know we should, we resent those that go on and do it.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: Once while in a restaurant, Pablo Picasso was asked by a fan to draw something upon a napkin for him. When the artist finished, the fan asked, ""Great! Now how much would you want for this?"" Forty dollars, please, replied Picasso.. That much! But it only took you a few moments! Not so my friend. It took my entire lifetime.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested.
Author: Bacon

Quote: We need to turn our mirrors into windows, seeing others and not only ourselves.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: Forgive, forget, and forge ahead.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: Maturity is the ability to postpone instant gratification for a greater goal or purpose.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: I have yet to see a referee change a call because of an insult.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: Sometimes making your point is like hammering a nail; once you've driven it in, additional strokes simply do damage.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: One ""Thank you"" at the right time is all that is needed.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: Effective leadership begins on the inside and moves out. Only people who genuinely like themselves can build the self-esteem of others without feeling that it takes something away from them.
Author: Ken Blanchard

Quote: Choose what you love and love what you choose.
Author: Lao Te Ching

Quote: Go as far as you can see and when you get there, you will always be able to see farther.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: It's important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them, and important to friendship that we are not.
Author: Mignon McLaughlin

Quote: His past was no more to him than the eggshell is to the eagle.
Author: Margaret Deland

Quote: Never regret. If it's good, it's wonderful. If it's bad, it's experience.
Author: Victoria Holt

Quote: Talk often, but never long.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: Depend upon it, you will sink or rise to the level of the company which you commonly keep.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: A good heart desires rather to conceal than expose other people's weaknesses or misfortunes.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: The more you know, the more modest you should be.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: Excellencies, if they are real, they will infallibly be discovered, without your pointing them out yourself, and with much more advantage.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: Endeavor, as much as you can, to keep company with people above you. There you rise, as much as you sink with people below you; for you are whatever the company you keep is.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: Darkness cannot shut me in again. I have had a glimpse of the shore, and can now live by the hope of reaching it.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: Be slow to give your real friendship, but when you have given it strive to make it lasting; for it is as reprehensible to make many changes in oneâ€™s associates as to have not friends at all. Neither test your friends to your own injury nor be willing to forego a test of your companions.
Author: Isocrates

Quote: A man never likes you so well as when he leaves your company liking himself.
Author: Author Unknown

Quote: Never esteem anything as of advantage to thee that shall make thee break thy word or lose thy self-respect.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: We must expend energy to have energy.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: Those who never retract their opinions love themselves more than they love the truth.
Author: Venning

Quote: You can have anything you want if you want it desperately enough. You must want it with an exuberance that erupts through the skin and joins the energy that created the world.
Author: Sheila Graham

Quote: To be happy at home is the ultimate result of all ambition.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: It is not the number of books you read, nor the variety of sermons you hear, nor the amount of religious conversation in which you mix, but is the frequency and earnestness with which you meditate on these things till the truth in them becomes your own and part of your being, that ensures your growth.
Author: Frederick W. Robertson

Quote: Nine times out of ten the best thing that can happen to a young man is to be tossed overboard and compelled to sink or swim.
Author: James A. Garfield

Quote: When we are alone, we have our thoughts to watch; in the family, our tempers; and in company, our tongues.
Author: H. More

Quote: Flattery is telling the other person precisely what he thinks about himself.
Author: Author Unknown

Quote: A great man shows his greatness by the way he treats little men.
Author: Thomas Carlyle

Quote: In almost any subject, your passion for the subject will save you. If you care enough for a result, you will most certainly attain it. If you wish to be good, you will be good. If you wish to be rich, you will be rich. If you wish to be learned, you will be learned. Only then you must really wish these things and wish them with exclusiveness and not with one hundred other incompatible things just as strongly.
Author: William James

Quote: It is better to be controversial for the right reasons than to be popular for the wrong reason.
Author: Shimon Peres

Quote: All of us are as great as the cause we are serving and as small as we limit ourselves to our egos.
Author: Shimon Peres

Quote: Sell yourself with a sound bite. When people ask, ""What do you do?"" have an answer that you have prepared in advance that makes them want to know more about you.
Author: Sam Horn

Quote: To project the confidence you need to, always focus on the other person. It's hard to seem poised when you're worrying about how you look or whether you are saying the right thing. In order to lose this debilitating self-consciousness, focus your attention on others instead of on yourself.
Author: Sam Horn

Quote: How do you build self-discipline? The principle is simple: put off short-term gratification for long-term satisfaction.
Author: Robin S. Sharma

Quote: Discipline is having the courage and the inner strength to stop giving so much time to the unimportant things in your life and to start directing your energy to those high-impact activities which will make a measurable difference in the richness of your life.
Author: Robin S. Sharma

Quote: The best lightning-rod for your protection is your own spine.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: When character is present in our relationships, everything else tends to fall into place.
Author: Mike Akin

Quote: Most of our so-called reasoning consists in finding arguments for going on believing as we already do.
Author: James Harvey Robinson

Quote: Many people fail to make a favorable impression because they don't listen attentively. They have been so much concerned with what they are going to say next that they do not keep their ears open. Very important people have told me that they prefer good listeners to good talkers, but the ability to listen seems rarer than almost any other good trait.
Author: Isaac F. Marcosson

Quote: Oh, hard! that to fire others, the match itself must needs be wasting!
Author: Herman Melville

Quote: Ignorance is the parent of fear.
Author: Herman Melville

Quote: It is not seldom the case in this conventional world of ours... that when a person placed in command over his fellow-men finds one of them to be very significantly his superior in general pride of manhood, straightway against that man he conceives an unconquerable dislike and bitterness; and if he have a chance he will pull down and pulverize that subaltern's tower, and make a little heap of dust of it.
Author: Herman Melville

Quote: Think of all insults and criticisms as a series of fishhooks. You have the choice of whether to bite or swim away.
Author: Harold H. Bloomfield

Quote: I generally like calm, poised people more readily.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: So often when another person asks for advice, the best thing to say is, ""What do you think?
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: As a man grows wiser, he talks less and says more.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: I have yet to find the man, however exalted his station, who did not do better work and put forth greater effort under a spirit of approval than under a spirit of criticism.
Author: Charles Schwab

Quote: Think as wise men do, but speak as the common people do.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Boss your boss just as soon as you can. There is nothing he will like so well- if he is the right kind of boss. If he is not, he is not the man for you to remain with. Leave him whenever you can, even at a present sacrifice, and find one capable of discerning genius.
Author: Andrew Carnegie

Quote: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
Author: Zig Ziglar

Quote: Readily agreeing with negative feedback is just another form of defensiveness.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Beware of isolating when conversing in a group. All it takes is a simple, yet equally distributed, glance to each person present.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: The best teacher is the one who is able to take a simple subject and create a profound classroom discussion by asking deeply thought-provoking questions.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Being realistic is the most commonly traveled road to mediocrity.
Author: Will Smith

Quote: Your job should not be the most important thing in your life. The key to a successful and happy life is balance. Your job is part of that balance, but only a part. Make time for your family and friends - and for yourself.
Author: Steve Burke

Quote: Trusting your intuition means tuning in as deeply as you can to the energy you feel, following that energy moment to moment, trusting that it will lead you where you want to go and bring you everything you desire.
Author: Shakti Gawain

Quote: For some people, the longing to be popular far outweighs the longing to be respected, and their social media accounts can verify this.
Author: Paul Hiebert

Quote: The best way to have a good idea is to have a lot of ideas.
Author: Linus Pauling

Quote: If you are drawn to an enlightened teacher, it is because there is already enough presence in you to recognize presence in another. Egos, however, are drawn to false teachers. Darkness cannot recognize light. Only light can recognize light.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose -- and that is to support the ultimate career.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: I can't imagine a man really enjoying a book and reading it only once.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Meditation is used to let go of sensual desires, anger, laziness, restlessness, boredom, and doubt. Once these are let go, the mind is concentrated, and the world is clearer than ever.
Author: Buddhist Podcast

Quote: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches, but to reveal to him his own.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Nursing grudges is like nursing parasites of the heart.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: The first hour of the morning is the rudder of the day.
Author: David Alan Carlston

Quote: Don't assume a door is closed; you must push on it.
Author: Marian Wright Edelman

Quote: If other people's opinions are more important to you than your own, you are not in charge of your life.
Author: James R. Fisher Jr.

Quote: Failure and defeat and loss afflict us all. Expect it, learn to deal with it.
Author: Les Brown

Quote: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: All man's miseries derive from not being able to sit quietly in a room alone.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quote: Whatever is flexible and flowing will tend to grow; whatever is rigid and blocked will wither and die.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Success is measured by contribution, not acquisition.
Author: William Halamandaris

Quote: We show respect by being courteous, listening attentively, and maintaining eye contact, as well as by avoiding giving advice, lecturing, and using a condescending tone.
Author: Kathy Indermill

Quote: I challenge you to be great. To be great is to have character, integrity, and be true to noble principles.
Author: James E. Faust

Quote: Private choices are not private; they all have public consequences... Our society is the sum total of what millions of individuals do in their private lives. The sum total of private behavior has worldwide public consequences of enormous magnitude. There are no completely private choices.
Author: James E. Faust

Quote: If you have made mistakes, even serious ones, there is always another chance for you. What we call failure is not the falling down, but the staying down.
Author: Mary Pickford

Quote: Forethought spares afterthought.
Author: Amelia E. Barr

Quote: Forgiveness is the act of admitting we are like other people.
Author: Christina Baldwin

Quote: You can't have genius without patience.
Author: Margaret Deland

Quote: To save the mind from preying inwardly upon itself, it must be encouraged to some outward pursuit. There is no other way to elude apathy, or escape discontent; none other to guard the temper from that quarrel with itself, which ultimately ends in quarreling with all mankind.
Author: Fanny Burney

Quote: It is almost impossible to throw dirt on someone without getting a little on yourself.
Author: Abigail Van Buren

Quote: No matter how brilliantly an idea is stated, we will not really be moved unless we have already half-thought of it ourselves.
Author: Mignon McLaughlin

Quote: A mistake in judgment isn't fatal, but too much anxiety about a decision is.
Author: Pauline Kael

Quote: Where there is laughter there is always more health than sickness.
Author: Phyllis Bottome

Quote: People who know how to employ themselves, always find leisure moments, while those who do nothing are forever in a hurry.
Author: Marie-Jeanne Roland

Quote: A letter is a risky thing; the writer gambles on the reader's frame of mind.
Author: Margaret Deland

Quote: There is no place in the world where courtesy is so necessary as in the home.
Author: Helen Hathaway

Quote: No one would remember the Good Samaritan if he'd only had good intentions. He had money as well.
Author: Margaret Thatcher

Quote: Friends and good manners will carry you where money won't go.
Author: Margaret Walker

Quote: The farther behind I leave the past, the closer I am to forging my own character.
Author: Isabelle Eberhardt

Quote: I think perfectionism is based on the obsessive belief that if you run carefully enough, hitting each steppin-stone just right, you won't have to die. The truth is that you will die anyway and that a lot of people who aren't even looking at their feet are going to do a whole lot better than you, and have a lot more fun while they're doing it.
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: Dwelling on the negative simply contributes to its power.
Author: Shirley MacLaine

Quote: All things a man owns hold him far more than he holds them.
Author: Sigrid Undset

Quote: Nothing contributes so much to tranquilize the mind as a steady purpose-a point on which the soul may fix its intellectual eye.
Author: Mary Shelley

Quote: The power to question is the basis of all human progress.
Author: Indira Gandhi

Quote: The more you kick something that's dead, the worse it smells.
Author: Barbara Stanwyck

Quote: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.
Author: Christopher Crowfield

Quote: One can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: The world never puts a price on you higher than the one you put on yourself.
Author: Sonja Henie

Quote: To be criticised is not necessarily to be wrong.
Author: Sir Anthony Eden

Quote: The Peter Principle: In a hierarchy every employee tends to rise to his level of incompetence.
Author: Lawrence J. Peter

Quote: The things that a man does not say often reveal the understanding and penetration of his mind even more than the things he says.
Author: Robert A. Milikan

Quote: Of course, sometimes it is not possible to prepare an address fully, but it is much better to do so even if you intend to speak extemporaneously.
Author: Robert A. Taft

Quote: Happiness is beneficial for the body but it is grief that develops the powers of the mind.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quote: People don't ask for facts in making up their minds. They would rather have one good, soul-satisfying emotion than a dozen facts.
Author: Robert Keith Levitt

Quote: It is the heart which makes men eloquent.
Author: Latin proverb

Quote: He gives twice who gives quickly.
Author: Latin proverb

Quote: Boldness has genius, power, and magic in it.
Author: Goethe

Quote: Laziness grows on people; it begins in cobwebs and ends in iron chains. The more business a man has to do the more he is able to accomplish, for he learns to economize his time.
Author: Sir M. Hale

Quote: Judge of a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: My riches consist not in the extent of my possessions, but in the fewness of my wants.
Author: J. Brotherton

Quote: In taking revenge a man is but equal to his enemy, but in passing it over he is his superior.
Author: Bacon

Quote: Apt to promise is apt to forget.
Author: Thomas Fuller

Quote: It is only imperfection that complains of what is imperfect. The more perfect we are, the more gentle and quiet we become toward the defects of others.
Author: Fenelon

Quote: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
Author: Rousseau

Quote: Luxury makes a man so soft, that it is hard to please him, and easy to trouble him; so that his pleasures at last become his burden. Luxury is a nice master, hard to be pleased.
Author: Mackenzie

Quote: To be rich in admiration and free from envy; to rejoice greatly in the good of others; to love with such generosity of heart that your love is still a dear possession in absence or unkindnessâ€”these are the gifts of fortune which money cannot buy and without which money can buy nothing. He who has such a treasury of riches, being happy and valiant himself, in his own nature, will enjoy the universe as if it were his own estate; and help the man to whom he lends a hand to enjoy it with him.
Author: Robert Louis Stevenson

Quote: It is wise to be sure, but otherwise to be too sure.
Author: Sophi Irene Loeb

Quote: Like water which can clearly mirror the sky and the trees only so long as its surface is undisturbed, the mind can only reflect the true image of the self when it is tranquil and wholly relaxed.
Author: Indra Devi

Quote: The appetite grows for what it feeds on.
Author: Ida B. Wells

Quote: T'ain't worthwhile to wear a day all out before it comes.
Author: Sarah Orne Jewett

Quote: People who feel their character to be slight, hope to give it weight by inflation: but the blown bladder at its fullest distention is still empty.
Author: Hannah More

Quote: Ambition is peculiarly the passion of great minds. It is the aspiration after a sphere of those who feel within them the capability of filling one.
Author: Lady Wilde

Quote: The true secret of giving advice is, after you have honestly given it, to be perfectly indifferent whether it is taken or not, and never persist in trying to set people right.
Author: Hannah Whitall Smith

Quote: It is not advisable to venture unsolicited opinions. You should spare yourself the embarrassing discovery of their exact value to your listener.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: There can be no happiness if the things we believe in are different from the things we do.
Author: Freya Stark

Quote: From the first day in school until the day I graduated, everyone gave me one hundred plus in art. Well, where do you go in life? You go to the place where you got one hundred plus.
Author: Louse Nevelson

Quote: A good character will be soiled at least by frequent contact with a bad one.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: Prepare and digest your matter well in your own thoughts, and the words not unwilling will follow.
Author: Horace

Quote: Cheerfulness and good nature are the effects of virtue.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: Connections are absolutely necessary; and, if prudently formed, and ably maintained, the success of them is infallible.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: Reserves and cautions are very necessary to have, but very imprudent to show.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: I am convinced that education, more than nature, is the cause of that great difference which you see in the characters of men.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: Whoever is in a hurry, shows that the thing he is about is too big for him. Haste and hurry are very different things.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: Choose your pleasures for yourself, and do not let them be imposed upon you. Follow nature, and not fashion; weigh the present enjoyment of your pleasures against the necessary consequences of them, and then let your own common sense determine you choice.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: Be wiser than other people if you can; but do not tell them so.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: Travel is a component of education when seriously undertaken.
Author: Chesterfield

Quote: Ninety-nine days the word of the preacher should be buoyant and of good cheer, so that on the hundredth day the voice of censure may be a hundred times strong. This was Lincoln's way.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: I consider it a duty to myself and to others to be happy.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task; but it is my chief duty and joy to accomplish humble tasks as though they were great and noble.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: The world is sown with good; but unless I turn my glad thoughts into practical living and till my own field, I cannot reap a kernel of the good.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: If I am happy in spite of my deprivations, if my happiness is so deep that it is a faith, so thoughtful that it becomes a philosophy of life, -if, in short, I am an optimist, my testimony to the creed of optimism is worth hearing.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: The art of living rightly is like all arts; it must be learned and practiced with incessant care.
Author: Goethe

Quote: A prudent person profits from personal experience, a wise one from the experience of others.
Author: Joseph Collins

Quote: WHY and HOW are words so important that they cannot be too often used.
Author: Napolean

Quote: When a man has equipped himself by thought and study for a bigger job, it usually happens that promotion comes along even before it's expected.
Author: P.G. Winnett

Quote: Never shrink from doing anything which your business calls you to do. The man who is above his business may one day find his business above him.
Author: Drew

Quote: A duty dodged is like a debt unpaid; it is only deferred, and we must come back and settle the account at last.
Author: Joseph Newton

Quote: That which grows slowly endures.
Author: J.G. Holland

Quote: A man should always have his boots on, and be ready to go.
Author: Montaigne

Quote: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
Author: William James

Quote: Avoid witticisms at the expense of others.
Author: Horace Mann

Quote: One hour's sleep before midnight is worth three after.
Author: George Herbert

Quote: Refuse to be ill. Never tell people you are ill; never own it to yourself... man should resist it on principle on the outset.
Author: Bulwer-Lyton

Quote: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise.
Author: Proverbs 13:20

Quote: Never answer a letter while you are angry.
Author: Chinese proverb

Quote: Being unable to direct events, I govern myself.
Author: Montaigne

Quote: Have a real reserve with everybody and a seeming reserve with almost nobody; for it is very disagreeable to seem reserved but dangerous not to be so.
Author: Lord Chesterfield

Quote: Get someone else to blow your horn and the sound will carry twice as far.
Author: Will Rogers

Quote: He who praises everybody, praises nobody.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: Stillness of person and steadiness of features are signal marks of good breeding.
Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

Quote: The actions of men are the best interpreters of their thoughts.
Author: Locke

Quote: The very essence of all power to influence lies in getting the other person to participate. The mind that can do that has a powerful leverage on his human world.
Author: Harry Overstreet

Quote: We must make automatic habitual, as early as possible, as many useful actions as we can. The more of the details of our daily life we can hand over to the effortless custody of automatism, the more our higher powers of mind will be set free for their own proper work.
Author: William James

Quote: It is where a man spends his money that shows where his heart lies.
Author: A. Edwin Kiegin

Quote: A true man never frets about his place in the world, but just slides into it by the gravitation of his nature, and stays like a star.
Author: E.H. Chapin

Quote: Sincerity is impossible unless it pervades the whole being, and the pretense of it saps the very foundation of character.
Author: James Lowell

Quote: A quiet conscience makes one so serene.
Author: Byron

Quote: A man cannot utter two or three sentences without disclosing to intelligent ears precisely where he stands in life and thought, whether in the kingdom of the senses and the understanding, or in that of ideas and imagination, or in the realms of intuitions and duty.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: It's easy for a boss to awe his clerks, but a man who is feared to his face is hated behind his back. A competent boss can move among his men without having to draw an imaginary line between them, because they will see the real one if it exists.
Author: George Lorimer

Quote: Consider carefully before you say a hard word to a man, but never let a chance to say a good one go by. Praise judiciously bestowed is money invested.
Author: George Lorimer

Quote: No man can ask more than he gives. A fellow who can't take orders can't give them.
Author: George Lorimer

Quote: The art of living is to be engaged in the money game without being devoured by it.
Author: Jacob Needleman

Quote: Let us settle ourselves, and work and wedge our feet downward through the mud and slush of opinion, and prejudce, and tradition, and delusion, and appearance, that alluvion which covers the globe, till we come to a hard bottom and rocks in place, which we can call reality, and say, This is, and no mistake...
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Most of the luxuries, and many of the so-called comforts of life, are not only not indispensable, but positive hindrances to the elevation of mankind.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: As if you could kill time without injuring eternity.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Men sometimes speak as if the study of the classics would at length make way for more modern and practical studies; but the adventurous student will always study classics. For what are the classics but the noblest recorded thoughts of man?
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire.
Author: William Butler Yeats

Quote: Focusing your efforts on creating a new perception is more effective than trying to undo a current one.
Author: Kim Krisco

Quote: You can't escape it: if you are ""out there,"" you will encounter critics.
Author: Patricia Fripp

Quote: We read books to find out who we are. What other people, real or imaginary, do and think and feel is an essential guide to our understanding of what we ourselves are and may become.
Author: Ursula K. LeGuin

Quote: Good habits are not made on birthday, nor a Christian character at the new year. The workshop of character is everyday life. The uneventful and commonplace hour is where the battle is lost or won.
Author: Maltie D. Babcock

Quote: That which we persist in doing becomes easier to do; not that the nature of the thing is changed, but our power to do is increased.
Author: Heber J. Grant

Quote: Work is not always required... There is such a thing as sacred idleness, the cultivation of which is now fearfully neglected.
Author: George Macdonald

Quote: Those who contemplate the beauty of the earth find reserves of strength that will endure as long as life lasts. There is something infinitely healing in the repeated refrains of nature-the assurance that dawn comes after night and spring after winter.
Author: Rachel Carson

Quote: I judge people by their own principles - not by my own.
Author: Martin Luther King

Quote: Small kindnesses, small courtesies, small considerations, habitually practiced in our social intercourse, give a greater charm to the character than the display of great talent and accomplishments.
Author: Kelty

Quote: In theory it is easy to convince an ignorant person; in actual life, men not only object to offer themselves to be convinced, but hate the man who has convinced them.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: The cynic makes fun of all earnestness; he makes fun of everything and everyone who feels that something can be done... But in his heart of hearts he knows that he is a defeated man and that his cynicism is merely an expression of the fact that he has lost courage and is beaten.
Author: George E. Vincent

Quote: Suffering becomes beautiful when anyone bears great calamities with cheerfulness, not through insensibility but through greatness of mind.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: He will always be a slave who does not know how to live upon a little.
Author: Horace

Quote: When confronted with two courses of action I jot down on a piece of paper all the arguments in favor of each one- then on the opposite side I write the arguments pro and con and canceling them out, one against the other, I take the course indicated by what remains.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: No one loves the man whom he fears.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: Whenever you go out, draw the chin in, carry the crown of the head high, and fill the lungs to the utmost; drink in the sunshine; greet your friends with a smile, and put soul into every handclasp. Do not fear being misunderstood and do not waste a minute thinking about your enemies.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: If there is any one secret of success it lies in the ability to get the other person's point of view and see things from that person's angle as well as from your own.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: The ability to deal with people is as purchasable a commodity as sugar or coffee. And I will pay more for that ability than for any other under the sun.
Author: Andrew Carnegie

Quote: Look for seed of the same kind as you sow, [don't] hope to buy one kind with another kind. Friendship buys friendship; justice, justice; merit, success.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Wealth is power to execute design; power to give legs, feet, and actuality to thought.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Poverty demoralizes.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: You can't work individuals by general rules. Every man is a special case and needs a special pill.
Author: George Lorimer

Quote: Money is the product of virtue, but it will not give you virtue and it will not redeem your vices.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: Action seems to follow feeling, but really action and feeling go together; and by regulating the action, which is under the more direct control of the will, we can indirectly regulate the feeling, which is not.
Author: William James

Quote: Having the right kind of attitude is just as important as having the right set of skills.
Author: William J. Winslow

Quote: Ideas are such funny things; they never work unless you do.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Unless you can look interested when you are bored, you will never be a success socially.
Author: Unknown

Quote: Worry is the interest you pay on trouble before it comes.
Author: Unknown

Quote: As the internal-combustion engine runs on gasoline, so the person runs on self-esteem.
Author: Thomas Szasz

Quote: Deliberately cultivate the habit of being: a heightened awareness of real life's abundance.
Author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

Quote: If something is perplexing you at the moment, see the situation simply as an ingredient in the great recipe that is real life.
Author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

Quote: We carry our serenity with us.
Author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

Quote: You already possess all you need to be genuinely happy. Right now. Today. All you truly need is the awareness of the abundance that is already yours.
Author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

Quote: He who waits to do a great deal of good at once, will never do anything.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: Buddhist monks build inner strength and resolve through the vow of silence. Why does staying quiet for days on end build willpower? You are not giving in to the impulse to talk. And this courage and capacity quickly spill over into other areas of you life. Be silent.
Author: Robin S. Sharma

Quote: Fear defeats more people than any other thing in the world.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every human being has an inner sense of worth, of importance, of dignity. Wound that and you have lost that person forever. So when you love and respect a person you build him up and, accordingly, he loves and esteems you.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: It is better to create than to be learned; creating is the true essence of life.
Author: Niebuhr

Quote: The greatest thing in the world is to know how to belong to oneself.
Author: Montaigne

Quote: I do not speak the minds of others except to speak my own mind better.
Author: Montaigne

Quote: The character of a man is his principles drawn out and woven into himself.
Author: Lowell S. Bennion

Quote: It has done me good to be somewhat parched by the heat and drenched by the rain of life.
Author: Longfellow

Quote: If you can spend a perfectly useless afternoon every once in a while in a perfectly useless manner, you have learned how to live.
Author: Lin Yutang

Quote: We sometimes find ourselves changing our minds without any resistance or heavy emotion, but if we are told we are wrong, we resent the imputation and harden our hearts. We are incredibly heedless in the formation of our beliefs, but find ourselves filled with an illicit passion for them when anyone proposes to rob us of their companionship. It is obviously not the ideas themselves that are dear to us, but our self-esteem, which is threatened. We like to continue to believe what we have been accustomed to accept as true, and the resentment aroused when doubt is cast upon any of our assumptions leads us to seek every manner of excuse for clinging to it. The result is that most of our so-called reasoning consists in finding arguments for going on believing as we already do.
Author: James Harvey Robinson

Quote: Few human beings are proof against the implied flattery of rapt attention.
Author: Jack Woodford

Quote: I personally interviewed as many as 5,000 individuals a year for jobs, but rarely hired more than 100 of them. The problem with the others was that they only had a desire for a new job, not the determination to win one.
Author: J.C. Penney

Quote: Book! You'll do to give us the bare words and facts, but we come in to supply the thoughts.
Author: Herman Melville

Quote: In man or fish, wriggling is a sign of inferiority.
Author: Herman Melville

Quote: I try all things; I achieve what I can.
Author: Herman Melville

Quote: Few men's courage is proof against protracted meditation unrelieved by action.
Author: Herman Melville

Quote: His pure tight skin was an excellent fit; and closely wrapped up in it, and embalmed with inner health and strength... his interior vitality was warranted to do well in all climates. Looking into his eyes, you seemed to see there the yet lingering images of those thousand-fold perils he had calmly confronted through life. A staid, steadfast man, whose life for the most part was a telling pantomime of action, and not a tame chapter of words... In him courage was not a sentiment but a thing simply useful to him, and always at hand.
Author: Herman Melville

Quote: A real friend will not visit you in prosperity unless he is invited, but when you are in adversity he will call without invitation.
Author: Chinese proverb

Quote: A man without a smiling face must not open a shop.
Author: Chinese proverb

Quote: To lay your past to rest, you must face the situation directly. This includes serious soul-searching and draining old pockets of pain.
Author: Carla Perez

Quote: Talk to people about themselves and they will listen for hours.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: An honest man is one who knows that he can't consume more than he has produced.
Author: Ayn Rand

Quote: Find ways of improving... that are beyond your own realm of responsibility. You may be right or you may be wrong, but in either case you have gained the first condition of success. You have attracted attention. Your initiative might sometimes put you into conflict with your superiors, but that is a risk worth taking.
Author: Andrew Carnegie

Quote: My way of opening and winning an argument is to first find a common ground of agreement.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: The order I enclose is not of record. If you succeed, you need not publish the order. If you fail, publish it. Then, if you succeed, you will have all the credit of the movement. If not, I'll take all the responsibility.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Riches enlarge, rather than satisfy appetites.
Author: Thomas Fuller

Quote: The poor and the middle class work for money. The rich have money work for them.
Author: Robert Kiyosaki

Quote: In school we learn that mistakes are bad, and we are punished for making them. Yet, if you look at the way humans are designed to learn, we learn by making mistakes. We learn to walk by falling down. If we never fell down, we would never walk.
Author: Robert Kiyosaki

Quote: Winners are not afraid of losing. But losers are. Failure is part of the process of success. People who avoid failure also avoid success.
Author: Robert Kiyosaki

Quote: An intelligent person hires people who are more intelligent than he is.
Author: Robert Kiyosaki

Quote: Endurance is the struggle to continue against a mounting desire to stop.
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote: Your brain forces you to slow down long before you are in real physiological distress. The limits we encounter during exercie aren't a consequence of failing muscles; they're imposed in advance by the brain to ensure we never reach true failure.
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote: Fatigue ultimately resides in the brain. The decision to speed up, slow down, or quit is always voluntary, not forced upon you by the failure of your muscles.
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote: Effort is what connects physical fatigue to performance--which means that anything that alters your perception of effort can alter your endurance, independent of what is happening in your muscles.
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote: Anything that moves the "effort dial" in your head up or down affects how far or fast you can run. Start believing and visualizing that you can run at a 6:40 pace with an easy effort and it will become your reality.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: It is no coincidence that coaches have long instructed runners to "relax your jaw". Smiling enhances cognitive ease, a concept intimately tied to effort.
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote: Pain can be strangely satisfying to the highly motivated athlete. Instead of blocking out the pain, try to accept it and feel it as much as possible.
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote: Avoiding thirst, rather than avoiding dehydration, seems to be the most important key to performance. Being fully hydrated at the start line is more important than how much you drink during the race.
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote: Effort is what matters and you train effort by training the body. If you want running at a 6:00-mile pace to feel easier, you should head out the door and run a 6:00-mile pace--a lot. This will enable you to maintain the pace with less physiological strain and since the pace will feel easier you will be able to sustain it for longer.
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote: Few parents have the courage and independence to care more for their children’s happiness than for their success.
Author: Alfie Kohn

Quote: The way kids learn to make good decisions is by making decisions, not by following directions.
Author: Alfie Kohn

Quote: I realized that this is what many people in our society seem to want most from children: not that they are caring or creative or curious, but simply that they are well behaved.
Author: Alfie Kohn

Quote: We can’t always assume that because we’re more mature we necessarily have more insight into our children than they have into themselves.
Author: Alfie Kohn

Quote: Name it to tame it. Tell stories to calm big emotions. If a child is afraid of the boogeyman, tell them to picture the boogeyman wearing a tutu and a cowboy hat.
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: Connect with the right brain (emotions) and redirect to the left (logic).
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: An upstairs tantrum is when your child decides to throw a fit in an attempt to get something they want (throwing a fit in the mall because you won’t buy them what they want). The solution for upstairs tantrums is to never negotiate. Firm boundaries and a clear discussion about appropriate and inappropriate behaviors is required. A downstairs tantrum is when a child is so upset that they’ve lost their ability to use their upstairs brain. For example, a toddler who starts screaming and swinging punches because you poured water on his head. The best response here is nurturing and patience.
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: Be STEADY. Children need you to be calm when they are agitated, strong when they are weak, confident when they are fearful. It’s what they expect of their heroes and it’s what they expect of you.
Author: Meg Meeker
Source: Hero: Becoming the Dad Your Children Need

Quote: Be firm. Many parents today want to be their children’s friends. Get this loud and clear, you are not their friend. You are their dad. Discipline is necessary and, Dad, you need to be the enforcer of the family rules.
Author: Meg Meeker
Source: Hero: Becoming the Dad Your Children Need

Quote: The goal of discipline is always for your child’s benefit, not retaliation. The benefits of good discipline are stronger self-reliant kids, kids with better self-control, and kids who feel cared for.
Author: Meg Meeker
Source: Hero: Becoming the Dad Your Children Need
