Quote: Speak less and listen more. Dad’s are often the strong, silent types. If you are a good listener, your daughters will tell you a lot. You don’t always have to give advice, simply listening and being attentive is often enough.
Author: Meg Meeker
Source: Hero: Becoming the Dad Your Children Need

Quote: Teach your kids to be courageous: to have the internal fortitude to do what is right, true, and noble no matter the personal cost
Author: Meg Meeker
Source: Hero: Becoming the Dad Your Children Need

Quote: Silence, the strong self-controlled silence of a father, can speak volumes. Self-restraint and quiet courage may be rare virtues in our trash-talking, self-centered age, but they are virtues nonetheless.
Author: Meg Meeker
Source: Hero: Becoming the Dad Your Children Need

Quote: John Denny is an NFL long snapper for the Miami Dolphins and member of the LDS church. When asked if he felt like his parents raised him in a bubble, he said “yes, but it was a great one. I knew what was expected of me and I knew what my parents expected of themselves. My father set the standard for us and he was consistent in what he did.”
Author: Meg Meeker
Source: Hero: Becoming the Dad Your Children Need

Quote:
How to be a great dad:
1. Show up. Not just at events, but every day being present. Put down your phone when talking to your kids. Say I love you. Don’t shy away or take it personally when they get mad at you. Stay calm and prove your love.
2. Communicate simple truths. Praise their character, not what they do. Let them catch you talking about them (praising them to others). Be there when they fail.
3. Talk about their futures in specific ways. Dream with them.
Author: Meg Meeker
Source: Hero: Becoming the Dad Your Children Need

Quote: The process of training expands the capabilities of the muscles and heart, sure, but it also recalibrates the brain's horizons to what is possible. In this sense, all training is brain training.
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote: Whatever you've done before, you can do that again plus a little more.
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote:
Haiku for running faster:
Run a lot of miles
Some faster than your race pace
Rest once in a while
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote: The single biggest piece of advice I would give is to pursue motivational self-talk training--with diligence and no snickering.
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote: Science has confirmed what athlets have always intuited: that there's more in there if you're willing to believe it.
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote: When I line up for a race, I remind myself that my fiercest opponent will be my own brain's well-meaning protective circuitry.
Author: Alex Hutchinson

Quote: The foundation of the No-Drama Discipline approach is “connect and redirect”.
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: Financial freedom is the state where cash influx gets significantly increased, but work reduces.
Author: Set For Life

Quote: Simply by naming the emotion, a person feels her levels of fear and anger decrease. That’s how the upstairs brain can calm the downstairs brain. And that’s a skill that can last a lifetime.
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: Our message to our children should be, “You can feel whatever you feel, but you can’t always do whatever you want to do.”
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: When we give a child the opportunity to decide how he should act, rather than simply telling him what he should do, he becomes a better decision maker.
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: Peace and serenity come from letting go of your attachment to your goals and their outcomes.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Regular running is satisfying in itself. Progress can be a great motivator and a great incentive to keep exercising.
Author: Scott Jurek - Eat & Run

Quote: Whatever you’re not changing, you’re choosing.
Author: Ryan Holiday

Quote: From its inception in the English language, “discipline” has meant “to teach.”
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: Our bruises and scars become armor. Our struggles become experience. They make us better. They are the flavoring that makes victory taste so sweet.
Author: Ryan Holiday

Quote: There is no one who has achieved greatness without wrestling with their own doubts, anxieties, limitations, and demons.
Author: Ryan Holiday

Quote: Curiosity is the cornerstone of effective discipline. Before you ever respond to your child’s behavior, ask yourself a question: ‘I wonder why my child did that.’
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: The majority of us find it hard to be joyful because we often focus on the things we want and completely lose sight of the things we have.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: When your child is at his worst, that’s when he needs you the most.
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: Fear alerts us to danger, but also to opportunity. If it wasn’t scary, everyone would do it. If it was easy, there wouldn’t be any growth in it. That tinge of self-preservation is the pinging of the metal detector going off. We may have found something. Will we ignore it? Or will we dig?
Author: Ryan Holiday

Quote: One of the best tools to keep ready in your parenting toolbox is creativity. There’s no one-size-fits-all discipline technique to use in every situation.
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: Many never get rich because the fear of losing money outweighs the fear of getting it.
Author: Robert Kiyosaki

Quote: It’s a complicated yet straightforward calculus: Run until you find it impossible to go on. Then keep at it, take another step. Key into your willpower, and new sources of energy will emerge.
Author: Scott Jurek - Eat & Run

Quote: The run can be a meditation-in-motion, a cleansing of all the sensory realities we encounter. The run is white noise, a way to simply experience time as a body, a piston, that exists away from the mind and only in the body as a live reactive presence. Running is escapism, but it is also the opposite. It can be the ultimate expression of being awake and alive only as a body that occupies space and time.
Author: Matthew Futterman

Quote: Shortening your commute can make you happier, healthier, and wealthier. It can speed you down the path toward early financial freedom.
Author: Set For Life

Quote: The key to lasting joy is to stay focused on gratitude. I would never trade away all that I have for what I have not. And unless that equilibrium ever changes, there is nothing I truly lack.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Deep, empathic connection can and should be combined with clear and firm boundaries that create needed structure in children’s lives. The absence of limits and boundaries is actually quite stressful, and stressed kids are more reactive.
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: Stress and anxiety often come from too much expectation and too much ambition.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: When you see hard times as moments that will soon pass, you will be a lot less stressed and frustrated.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Compromise isn’t a sign of weakness; it’s evidence of respect for your child and his desires. It’s okay to rethink your position if you realize it is important to your child and you don’t have a good reason for saying no.
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: When children are involved in the process of discipline, they feel more respected, they buy into what the parents are promoting, and they are therefore more apt to cooperate and even help come up with solutions to the problems that created the need for discipline in the first place. As a result, parents and children work as a team to figure out how best to address disciplinary situations.
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: When fear is defined, it can be defeated. When downside is articulated, it can be weighed against upside. When the wolves are counted, there are fewer of them. Mountains turn out to be molehills, monsters turn out just to be men.
Author: Ryan Holiday

Quote: Sometimes there’s just nothing we can do to “fix” things when our kids are having a hard time. We can work to stay calm and loving. We can be fully present. We can access the full measure of our creativity. And still, we may not be able to make things better right away. Sometimes all we have to offer is our presence as our children move through the emotions.
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: Changing our emotions is quite hard, but changing our perspective is relatively easy.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote:
Discipline Strategy:
Reduce words
Embrace emotions 
Describe, don’t preach 
Involve your child in the discipline 
Reframe a no into a conditional yes Emphasize the positive 
Creatively approach the situation 
Teach mindsight tools
Author: Daniel J. Siegel & Tina Bryson

Quote: Courage is not the absence of fear, but the ability to act despite it.
Author: Desmond Tutu

Quote: If you are aware of something that can change you for the better, count 5-4-3-2-1 and move.
Author: Mel Robbins - 5 Second Rule

Quote: If you wish to improve, be content to appear clueless or stupid.
Author: Epictetus

Quote: He tells them to run to the threshold, to that edge where you are running at a pace that is as hard as you can go without having to slow down. It’s the precipice between aerobic, where the lungs learn to breathe almost normally throughout the activity, and anaerobic, where they do not and the power does not depend on the efficiency of the cardiovascular system. Maintain that, for as long as you can.
Author: Matthew Futterman

Quote: It’s about the search for the edge. They won’t search for it every day, but several times each week. To find that spot where one click more is too fast to maintain, and one click less feels just slightly too comfortable. They will hold it there, for five miles, and then six and seven, as long as they can.
Author: Matthew Futterman

Quote: Another cornerstone—when you think you are running hard, run harder. Try to keep running harder for longer than you think you can, bringing your body and your mind closer to the edge, that moment when the ritual becomes the revelation. This is the origin of what eventually everyone will refer to as the tempo run. How fast? Enough so that it hurts, because eventually it starts to hurt less, which means it’s time to go even faster.
Author: Matthew Futterman

Quote: If the goal is noble, your commitment to the goal should not be contingent on your ability to attain it. Peace and equanimity come from letting go of our attachment to the goal and the method.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Anthony Ray Hilton spent thirty years on death row for a crime he didn’t commit. He said: “One does not know the value of freedom until it is taken away. People run out of the rain. I run into the rain. How can anything that falls from heaven not be precious? Having missed the rain for so many years, I am so grateful for every drop. Just to feel it on my face.”
Author: Anthony Ray Hilton

Quote: Keep the legs churning, the feet under the body, the knees driving forward. The speed comes from reducing contact time and getting that foot back in the air as quickly as possible.
Author: Matthew Futterman

Quote: The marathon is twenty miles of transportation and a six-mile race.
Author: Matthew Futterman

Quote: This book contains twenty-nine Renegade Rules, but it can really be summed up with one, which I call the Renegade Golden Rule: It’s OK If It’s Not Hurting People or Property.
Author: Heather Shumaker

Quote: I never tell children to stop running because they’ll get hurt. Running is normal. Kids are in motion. And, if they do get hurt, they’ll learn it better.
Author: Heather Shumaker

Quote: Every aspect of a run, from the pain it produced to the weather conditions, offered me a choice: Is this a thought that will slow me down? Or can I find a perspective that will speed me up?
Author: Deena Kastor

Quote: Repetition is the mother of learning. Repetition of speed built power. Repetition of miles built endurance.
Author: Deena Kastor

Quote: The same qualities that build a better person also build a better athlete. Perseverance and discipline, but also creativity, intelligence, and patience. Few things will help you more than being a disciplined student of the sport.
Author: Joe Vigil

Quote: There is no such thing as overtraining, just underresting.
Author: Joe Vigil

Quote: “Pace” for a runner can be a limiter. Sometimes you need to have a backup plan for when your strength exceeds your own expectations.
Author: Deena Kastor

Quote: When you’re well conditioned, when your breath and your legs are in sync, and when your mind is immersed only in the task at hand, there is nothing blocking your momentum.
Author: Deena Kastor

Quote: The strength I developed came from not being afraid of the fatigue. Every cell in my body still shouted I’m exhausted! by the end of each long run. But my mind was quick to respond. Yes, but you can still move forward.
Author: Deena Kastor

Quote: Happiness is the joy we feel striving after our potential.
Author: Shawn Achor

Quote: Biochemistry of Belief: Each and every tiny cell in our body is perfectly and absolutely aware of our thoughts, feelings, and of course, our beliefs….If you believe you are fragile, the biochemistry of your body unquestionably obeys and manifests it. If you believe you are tough, irrespective of your weight and bone density, your body undeniably mirrors it.
Author: Deena Kastor

Quote: One key difference between expert and novice athletes is in the way they learn to perceive the game, rather than raw ability.
Author: David Epstein

Quote: In a turbulent, modern world, the ability to rethink and unlearn might matter more than raw intelligence.
Author: Adam Grant

Quote: The sweet spot of confidence/humility: You can be confident in your ability to achieve a goal in the future while maintaining the humility to question whether you have the right tools in the present.
Author: Adam Grant

Quote: The most effective leaders score high in both confidence and humility. Although they have faith in their strengths, they’re also keenly aware of their weaknesses.
Author: Adam Grant

Quote: A great spiritual teacher once said, “Every day bite off more than you can chew, and chew it.”
Author: Michael Singer

Quote: This (money) meant nothing to me and so much to them. This was another one of life’s lessons I never forgot: the joy of helping people.
Author: Michael Singer

Quote: I clearly remember deciding that from now on if life was unfolding in a certain way, and the only reason I was resisting it was because of a personal preference, I would let go of my preference and let life be in charge.
Author: Michael Singer

Quote: Don’t ask kids “what they want to be when they grow up.” Kids might be better off learning about careers as actions to take rather than identities to claim.
Author: Adam Grant

Quote: At work and in life, the best we can do is plan for what we want to learn and contribute over the next year or two, and stay open to what might come next.
Author: Adam Grant

Quote: You don’t have to swing for the fences in everything you do. Cruise control can be an effective, low-stress way not only to run your fastest but to reach your full potential in many areas of life.
Author: Meb Keflezghi

Quote: Know your limits, pushing up to the edge of them, and then have the discipline to pull back a bit. In running, you’ll make more progress and get injured less often if you finish runs feeling like there’s more in the tank.
Author: Meb Keflezghi

Quote: The people who have long, successful careers in any endeavor are those who consistently work hard but don’t push themselves so much that they break down, physically or mentally. In the time when others are going the extra mile, recharge and refresh yourself so that you can be your best tomorrow.
Author: Meb Keflezghi

Quote: It’s better to be undertrained than overtrained. Around ⅓ of Olympic marathoners enter race day with a nagging injury and another ⅓ have overtrained and muscles aren’t as fresh as they could be. One of Meb’s best marathons was when he tore his quad 12 weeks prior to the race and only had 8 weeks of slow build up because he prioritized recovery and listened to his body.
Author: Meb Keflezghi

Quote: One way the marathon is different from other races is that its lessons often have parallels in the rest of life. The patience needed to master the marathon is a transferable skill. Taking the long view, putting in the unglamorous daily work, finding joy in the process, saving something for the inevitable challenges—these traits have helped me be a better husband, father, brother, and friend. The greatest rewards I’ve felt from all those roles in my life have come over the long term, not through immediate payoff.
Author: Meb Keflezghi

Quote: No success is shorter lived than the endlessly ambitious. Greed moves the goalposts, preventing one from ever enjoying what one has.
Author: Ryan Holiday

Quote: More than talent, life is about temperament.
Author: Ryan Holiday

Quote: If we don’t dominate ourselves physically, who and what does dominate? Outside forces. Laziness. Adversity. Entropy. Atrophy. We do the work, today and always, because it’s what we’re here for.
Author: Ryan Holiday

Quote: Those who think that they can live a high spiritual life whose bodies are filled with idleness and luxuries are mistaken.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Quote: Parent the child you have. Stop trying to make your child quieter, louder, more outgoing, more interested in things their sibling likes and appreciate the unique and individual small person you’ve been given.
Author: Unknown

Quote: A lot of parents will do anything for their kids, except let them be themselves.
Author: How Dutch Parents Help Their Kids by Doing Less
Source: Happiest Kids in the World Are Dutch

Quote: One of the biggest lessons to learn as a parent is that your child is not a mini version of you.
Author: How Dutch Parents Help Their Kids by Doing Less
Source: Happiest Kids in the World Are Dutch

Quote: Approach the marathon with joy and gratitude, not as a life-or-death thing.
Author: Molly Seidel

Quote: A life in which we can enjoy the world and live with purpose, can only be built if we do more than live for ourselves.
Author: Eric Greitens

Quote: Before making a decision (big or small), ask yourself: “How will I feel about this decision in 10 minutes, 10 months, and 10 years?”
Author: Ben Meer

Quote: Raise your floor, not your ceiling. You want to get to the point where what once seemed difficult to achieve becomes the norm.
Author: Steve Magness

Quote: Our identities need to be strong and flexible, but not set in stone; otherwise a threat to that identity can cause the statue of self to crumble.
Author: Steve Magness

Quote: Tough people don’t live in a black and white world of success or failure. They are able to adjust, and pore their ability to persist into a new worthwhile goal.
Author: Steve Magness

Quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
Author: Seneca

Quote: Children sit at our dinner table for nearly two decades listening to us rant and pontificate. If we don’t learn how to moderate our tendency to righteously rain down the truth, we will short-circuit our kids’ ability to think well. It takes self-control to be a thoughtful thinker.
Author: Julie Bogart

Quote: Take your audience on a journey. Make your stories so descriptive and rich with imagery that they imagine themselves with you at the time if the event. Try to engage the five senses.
Author: Carmine Gallo

Quote: If all we’ve ever known about a topic is what we’ve read, then we aren’t experts. Experiencing is the deepest form of learning.
Author: Julie Bogart

Quote: Our biases, left unchecked, control our thinking. Self-awareness is what we need to recognize bias and consider other alternatives.
Author: Julie Bogart

Quote: Insight is much more important in education than is memorization.
Author: Julie Bogart

Quote: You have the right to change your mind. Context is everything.
Author: Julie Bogart

Quote: Confidence is silent. Insecurities are loud.
Author: Marlon Brando

Quote: This was a quick read and I finished it in two days, but it elevated my soul and mindset. It was more than just a pump-up motivational book--the lessons here are real and deep and come with powerful stories. This is a great book to read again if you ever feel yourself developing a "victim mindset". John really convinced me that disease is a gift for us to strengthen our character. There were a lot of people in this book worth emulating and reading about them alone gives me examples to aspire to.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Always ask, “What More Can I Do”? One person can make a huge difference in another’s life. Jack Buck visited John every day in the hospital, and then had him be in the announcers box, and then sent baseballs to his house, and then gave him his hall if fame baseball. One text to a grieving friend is good, but what more can you do? Also, Jack didn’t know John. He just saw a struggling boy and gave his whole heart to him. You can always find someone to serve.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: When you know your “why”, you can accomplish any “how”. Create an Ignition Statement which is a constant reminder of what you are working for. John’s Ignition Statement is “Because God demands it, my family deserves it, and the world is starved for it.”
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: My brain surgery was an inflection point in my life. It gave me a victorious mentality that I could do hard things and overcome. I had to choose to fight for my life at the age of 11 rather than just drifting through life. There was a point when I couldn’t talk—my words all mumbled together and I couldn’t walk or use a pencil. I had to relearn all these skills and this conscious effort to do basic things left me with gratitude for everything.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Be like Jack Buck. He paid attention to others around him. His life wasn’t about him. He didn’t keep score. His time wasn’t about what he could get. He visited a “nobody” every day for five months and told him to keep fighting. The key to true greatness in life is to pursue significance over success.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: I'd wager that this is one of the most well-written memoirs out there. The story was interesting but it was the style of writing that made the book so compelling. I envy the way Phil Knight thinks about things and his ability to draw life lessons and business lessons from all sorts of places. This is a book worth reading again at some point.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Focusing on one single task will clear the mind.
Author: Phil Knight

Quote: Don’t tell people how to do things, tell them what to do and let them surprise you with their results
Author: George Patton

Quote: I was a linear thinker, and according to Zen linear thinking is nothing but a delusion, one of the many that keep us unhappy. Reality is nonlinear, Zen says. No future, no past. All is now.
Author: Phil Knight

Quote: When Phil was visiting Onitsuka in Japan, he talked to some random lower level employee who said he lost everything including his bicycle. When Phil returned to the US he mailed the guy fifty bucks and told him it was for a new bike. This man ended up becoming a key player in the survival of Blue Ribbon. Be generous.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Distance running has taught me endurance not only on the pavement but also in life. Even when my body or mind are begging for me to stop, I just keep moving.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Interpret other people’s statements in their best, most reasonable form, not in the worst or most offensive way possible. Anytime you feel a flash of negativity, remind yourself of the untruth that the world is not full of good or bad people.
Author: Jonathan Haidt
Source: The Coddling of the American Mind

Quote: There is a fear of being demonized that is rapidly growing where if you voice opinions that are contrary to the majority, people will protest against you. This is a problem because it encourages group think and limits the though conversations of trying to understand the other side. I was maybe coddled a bit too much growing up where I was made to believe that hearing other ideas contrary to mine was unsafe because it might corrupt me. Maybe that is true for a child but it doesn’t hold up for adults. I should seek out opinions on both sides to increase my understanding and empathy.
Author: Zach Stanford
Source: The Coddling of the American Mind

Quote: Giving students iPads prepares them for a high-tech economy about as much as playing with Hot Wheels would prepare them to thrive as auto mechanics.
Author: Cal Newport

Quote: The differences between expert performers and normal adults reflect a life-long pursuit of deliberate effort to improve performance in a specific domain.
Author: Cal Newport

Quote: Most people assume that relaxation makes them happy. We want to work less and spend more time in the hammock. But when measured empirically, people were happier at work and less happier relaxing than they suspected. Human beings are at their best when immersed deeply in something challenging.
Author: Cal Newport

Quote: At the end of the workday, shut down your consideration of work issues until the next morning.
Author: Cal Newport

Quote: To simply wait and be bored has become a novel experience in modern life, but from the perspective of concentration training, it is incredibly valuable.
Author: Cal Newport

Quote: If you are ever tempted to judge another person by their career title, remember that Jesus, after all, was a carpenter.
Author: Unknown

Quote: The Bible isn't a rule book. It's a love letter. It's not about my performance; it's about Jesus' performance for me.
Author: Jefferson Bethke

Quote: When I was trying to earn Jesus by being good, I missed the real Jesus who wants us to love him and serve him not for what he gives us but for who he is--dangerous, unpredictable, radical, and amazing.
Author: Jefferson Bethke

Quote: I need to give my life to Jesus instead of trying to be my own king. There is right and wrong; and Jesus will not condemn people to hell, but like CS Lewis said, people will condemn themselves by their pride.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Never underestimate the level of luck that it takes to become extremely successful. Studying a specific person can be dangerous because we tend to study extreme examples—the billionaires, the CEOs, or the massive failures that dominate the news—and extreme examples are often the least applicable to other situations, given their complexity. You’ll get closer to actionable takeaways by looking for broad patterns of success and failure.
Author: Morgan Housel

Quote: Not all success is due to hard work, and not all poverty is due to laziness. Keep this in mind when judging people, including yourself.
Author: Morgan Housel

Quote:
The hardest financial skill is getting the goalpost to stop moving. 

Happiness is just results minus expectations.
Author: Morgan Housel

Quote: Don’t get up from meditation until you are totally in love with life.
Author: Joe Dispenza

Quote: You have to take risk to get ahead, but no risk that can wipe you out is ever worth taking.
Author: Morgan Housel

Quote: Chi running is about (1) maintaining good posture (2) keeping your joints open and loose (3) making sure your muscles are relaxed and that you aren’t holding tension.
Author: Danny Dreyer

Quote: Just set up your body correctly and let the chi move through it. Let your mind do the work and your body relax. Don’t let muscles do it. Let chi do it.
Author: Danny Dreyer

Quote: Chi running is when speed is a function of your ability to relax more deeply, not your ability to push harder.
Author: Danny Dreyer

Quote: Happiness isn’t a destination; it’s a direction.
Author: Arthur C. Brooks

Quote: When you are in the present moment and as your brain waves change from beta to alpha and theta, the autonomic nervous system—which knows how to heal your body much better than your conscious mind does—gets to work.
Author: Joe Dispenza

Quote: Turning immaterial possibilities in the quantum field into reality requires two things: a clear intention and an elevated emotion.
Author: Joe Dispenza

Quote: If your brain believes something is aiding in the recovery process, it probably is.
Author: Runner’s World

Quote: Carefully track how you’re responding to your training—you want to notice yourself getting stronger and faster over time—and stay alert for signs of overtraining, like fatigue that you can’t shake.
Author: Runner’s World

Quote: You can be wrong half the time and still make a fortune. A small minority of things account for the majority of outcomes.
Author: Morgan Housel

Quote: Use money to gain control of your time. That is the highest dividend that exists in finance.
Author: Morgan Housel

Quote: A great investing strategy doesn’t rely on picking the right sector or timing the next recession. It relies on a high savings rate, patience, and optimism that the global economy will create value for several decades.
Author: Morgan Housel

Quote: You will know when you’re running with chi,  because it will no longer feel like work. It will take on a new sense of effortlessness.
Author: Danny Dreyer

Quote: Pure smiling has nothing to do with the mouth—it is all about the corners of your eyes. If you see someone with pronounced crows feet then it means they’ve been smiling a lot. Never get Botox because it will look like you haven’t enjoyed your life as much.
Author: Arthur C. Brooks

Quote: Happiness is not a destination. Happiness is a direction. We won’t find complete happiness on this side of heaven, but no matter where each of us is in life, we can all be happier. And then happier, and then happier still. The fact that complete happiness in this life is impossible might seem like disappointing news, but it isn’t. It’s the best news ever, actually. It means we all can finally stop looking for the lost city that doesn’t exist, once and for all. We can stop wondering what’s wrong with us because we can’t find or keep it. We can also stop believing that our individual problems are the reasons we haven’t achieved happiness. No positive circumstance can give us the state of bliss we seek. But no negative circumstance can make getting happier impossible, either. Here is a fact: You can get happier, even if you have problems. You can even get happier in some cases because you have problems.
Author: Arthur C. Brooks

Quote: The macronutrients of happiness are enjoyment, satisfaction, and purpose.
Author: Arthur C. Brooks

Quote: The common strategy of trying to eliminate suffering from life to get happier is futile and mistaken; we must instead look for the why of life to make pain an opportunity for growth. Getting happier, in other words, requires that we accept unhappiness in our lives as well, and understanding it isn’t an obstacle to our happiness.
Author: Arthur C. Brooks

Quote: Here’s the bottom line: Without unhappiness, you wouldn’t survive, learn, or come up with good ideas. Even if you could get rid of your unhappiness, it would be a huge mistake. The secret to the best life is to accept your unhappiness (so you can learn and grow) and manage the feelings that result.
Author: Arthur C. Brooks

Quote: Prayer is one of the most effective ways to consistently practice gratitude. And research has shown that gratitude is the most effective emotion for generating wellbeing.
Author: Arthur C. Brooks

Quote: You can achieve the Orbit by finding the personal courage to be genuine and to take the best course of action to get the job done rather than following the pallid path of corporate appropriateness.
Author: Gordon MacKenzie

Quote: Hairball is policy, procedure, conformity, compliance, rigidity; while Orbiting is originality, rules-breaking, experimentation, and innovation.
Author: Gordon MacKenzie

Quote: A fit body, a calm mind, a house full of love. These things cannot be bought – they must be earned.
Author: Naval Ravikant

Quote: Life is a balancing act. The more eggs you put in one basket, the bigger the loss if something happens to that basket.
Author: Meb Keflezghi

Quote: Trying to “win” workouts can get in the way of the main goal of any marathon training block, which is to get to the start line healthy and eager to race.
Author: Meb Keflezghi

Quote: When we find ourselves judging others, we should take note. It’s a signal that our minds are tricking us into thinking we’re moving forward when in truth we’re stuck. If I sold more apples than you did yesterday, but you sold more today, this says nothing about whether I’m improving as an apple seller. The more we define ourselves in relation to the people around us, the more lost we are.
Author: Jay Shetty

Quote: What is a cynic? A man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing.
Author: Burton G. Malkiel
Source: A Random Walk Down Wall Street

Quote: A random walk is one in which future steps or directions cannot be predicted on the basis of past history. When the term is applied to the stock market, it means that short-run changes in stock prices are unpredictable. Investment advisory services, earnings forecasts, and chart patterns are useless.
Author: Burton G. Malkiel
Source: A Random Walk Down Wall Street

Quote: A successful investor is generally a well-rounded individual who puts a natural curiosity and an intellectual interest to work.
Author: Burton G. Malkiel
Source: A Random Walk Down Wall Street

Quote: The key to investing is not how much an industry will affect society or even how much it will grow, but rather its ability to make and sustain profits. And history tells us that eventually all excessively exuberant markets succumb to the laws of gravity.
Author: Burton G. Malkiel
Source: A Random Walk Down Wall Street

Quote: It is not hard, really, to make money in the market. As we shall see later, an investor who simply buys and holds a broad-based portfolio of stocks can make reasonably generous long-run returns. What is hard to avoid is the alluring temptation to throw your money away on short, get-rich-quick speculative binges.
Author: Burton G. Malkiel
Source: A Random Walk Down Wall Street

Quote: One of the best-documented propositions in the field of finance is that, on average, investors have received higher rates of return for bearing greater risk.
Author: Burton G. Malkiel
Source: A Random Walk Down Wall Street

Quote: What Markowitz discovered was that portfolios of risky (volatile) stocks might be put together in such a way that the portfolio as a whole could be less risky than the individual stocks in it. The mathematics of modern portfolio theory (also known as MPT)
Author: Burton G. Malkiel
Source: A Random Walk Down Wall Street

Quote: The beta calculation is essentially a comparison between the movements of an individual stock (or portfolio) and the movements of the market as a whole.
Author: Burton G. Malkiel
Source: A Random Walk Down Wall Street

Quote: Chasing today’s hot investment usually leads to tomorrow’s investment freeze.
Author: Burton G. Malkiel
Source: A Random Walk Down Wall Street

Quote: Remember the advice of the legendary investor Warren Buffett: Lethargy bordering on sloth remains the best investment style. The correct holding period for the stock market is forever.
Author: Burton G. Malkiel
Source: A Random Walk Down Wall Street

Quote: We all wish that we had a little genie who could reliably tell us to “buy low and sell high.” Systematic rebalancing is the closest analogue we have.
Author: Burton G. Malkiel
Source: A Random Walk Down Wall Street

Quote: One of the biggest mistakes that investors make is to fail to obtain sufficient international diversification. The United States represents only about one-third of the world economy.
Author: Burton G. Malkiel
Source: A Random Walk Down Wall Street

Quote: Successful risk-takers have courage. They’re insanely competitive and their attitude is: bring it on.
Author: Nate Silver

Quote: Successful risk-takers have strategic empathy. They put themselves in their opponent’s shoes.
Author: Nate Silver

Quote: Successful risk-takers are process oriented, not results oriented. They play the long game.
Author: Nate Silver

Quote: In general, Silicon Valley does understand something about risk—something that most people in society don’t. It understands that a relatively remote chance is worth taking if it has a sufficiently high payoff.
Author: Nate Silver

Quote: Empathy also focuses us on the moment, making it harder for us to see the long-term impact of what we are doing. That is what happens in Ruinous Empathy—you’re so fixated on not hurting a person’s feelings in the moment that you don’t tell them something they’d be better off knowing in the long run.
Author: Kim Scott

Quote: Healthy emotional empathy makes for a more caring world. It can nurture social connection, concern, and insight. But unregulated emotional empathy can be the source of distress and burnout; it can also lead to withdrawal and moral apathy. Empathy is not compassion.
Author: Kim Scott

Quote: “Radical Candor” is what happens when you put “Care Personally” and “Challenge Directly” together.
Author: Kim Scott

Quote: Ultimately, though, bosses are responsible for results. They achieve these results not by doing all the work themselves but by guiding the people on their teams. Bosses guide a team to achieve results.
Author: Kim Scott

Quote: Start by asking for criticism, not by giving it Don’t dish it out before you show you can take it
Author: Kim Scott

Quote: Do all the right things to precision and “the score will take care of itself".
Author: Bill Walsh
Source: The Score Takes Care of Itself

Quote: Pursuing your ambitions, especially those of any magnitude, can be grueling and hazardous, and produce agonizing failure along the way, but achieving those goals is among life’s most gratifying and thrilling experiences. The ability to survive and overcome the former to attain the latter is a fundamental difference between winners and losers.
Author: Bill Walsh
Source: The Score Takes Care of Itself

Quote: I’ve observed that if individuals who prevail in a highly competitive environment have any one thing in common besides success, it is failure—and their ability to overcome it. “Crash and burn” is part of it; so are recovery and reward.
Author: Bill Walsh
Source: The Score Takes Care of Itself

Quote: Failure is part of success, an integral part. Everybody gets knocked down. Knowing it will happen and what you must do when it does is the first step back.
Author: Bill Walsh
Source: The Score Takes Care of Itself

Quote: Many can’t summon the strength; they can’t get up; their fight is over. Victory goes to another, a stronger competitor. Competition at the highest level in sports or business produces gut-ripping setbacks.
Author: Bill Walsh
Source: The Score Takes Care of Itself

Quote: Be bold. Remove fear of the unknown—that is, change—from your mind. Respect the past without clinging to it:
Author: Bill Walsh
Source: The Score Takes Care of Itself

Quote: Few things offer greater return on less investment than praise—offering credit to someone in your organization who has stepped up and done the job.
Author: Bill Walsh
Source: The Score Takes Care of Itself

Quote: Everybody’s got an opinion. Leaders are paid to make a decision. The difference between offering an opinion and making a decision is the difference between working for the leader and being the leader.
Author: Bill Walsh
Source: The Score Takes Care of Itself

Quote: Be concise. For many leaders it’s harder to be brief than to be long-winded. We love to hear ourselves talk.
Author: Bill Walsh
Source: The Score Takes Care of Itself

Quote: Children need a great deal of free play to thrive. It’s an imperative that’s evident across all mammal species. The small-scale challenges and setbacks that happen during play are like an inoculation that prepares children to face much larger challenges later.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: My central claim in this book is that these two trends—overprotection in the real world and underprotection in the virtual world—are the major reasons why children born after 1995 became the anxious generation.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote:
1. No smartphones before high school. Parents should delay children’s entry into round-the-clock internet access by giving only basic phones (phones with limited apps and no internet browser) before ninth grade (roughly age 14). 
2. No social media before 16. Let kids get through the most vulnerable period of brain development before connecting them to a firehose of social comparison and algorithmically chosen influencers.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: People (and dogs) who go through life in discover mode (except when directly threatened) are happier, more sociable, and more eager for new experiences. Conversely, people (and dogs) who are chronically in defend mode are more defensive and anxious, and they have only rare moments of perceived safety.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: Children are intrinsically antifragile, which is why overprotected children are more likely to become adolescents who are stuck in defend mode. Taleb coined the word “antifragile” to describe things that actually need to get knocked over now and then in order to become strong.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: As the Stoics and Buddhists taught long ago, happiness cannot be reached by eliminating all “triggers” from life; rather, happiness comes from learning to deprive external events of the power to trigger negative emotions in you.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: Kids who fall out of trees often turn into the adults who are least afraid of climbing trees.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: I suggest that we focus on even-year birthdays from ages 6 to 18. We might make a big deal out of those birthdays by linking them to new freedoms, new responsibilities, and significant increases in allowance. We want children to feel that they are climbing a ladder with clearly labeled rungs, rather than just having an annual party with games, cake, and presents. It might look something like this:
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: Safetyism is an experience blocker.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: People who live only in networks, rather than communities, are less likely to thrive.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: Research consistently shows that teens who play team sports are happier than those who don’t.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: Meditation helps to calm the monkey mind. Over time, the nature of conscious experience changes, even when one is not meditating. Studies on Buddhist monks suggest that their intense meditation practices alter their brains in lasting ways, decreasing activation in brain areas related to fear and negative emotionality.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: What young children need is a lot of time to interact with you, with other loving adults, with other kids, and with the real world.
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: The four foundational reforms are: No smartphones before high school No social media before 16 Phone-free schools Far more unsupervised play and childhood independence
Author: Jonathan Haidt

Quote: The correlation between regular exercise and health, success, and happiness is undeniable. Make time for physical fitness and you will net more time in the end, thanks to higher productivity. Lift. Run. Move.
Author: Scott Galloway

Quote: Tip well. You’ll get better service, feel happier, and live longer.
Author: Scott Galloway

Quote: Don’t follow your passion. Follow your talent.
Author: Scott Galloway

Quote: Embrace this day with an enthusiastic welcome, no matter how it looks.
Author: F. Enzio Bushe

Quote: Philosophers disagree about this, but I do think there is such a thing as absolute truth. We need to distinguish the question of truth from the question of knowledge. It may well be there is no such thing as ""absolutely certain knowledge,"" something we believe to be true and that we couldn't possibly be wrong about. But whether we can know an absolute truth for certain or not, there could be such truth.
Author: Peter Lipton

Quote: How could an all-powerful, perfectly good Being permit suffering to occur? The answer is pretty simple. All that must be done is to deny that suffering is a bad thing. This can be done in a number of ways: One can argue, for example, that we only regard sufferring as bad because we fail to understand God's larger purpose in allowing suffering--perhaps, it's actually good, because it leads to greater wisdom or character than we'd obtain otherwise.
Author: Louise Antony

Quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Our life is frittered away by detail. Simplicity, simplicity, simplicity!
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived. I wanted to live deep and suck out all the marrow of life.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: Meditation is not about getting rid of all your thoughts; it's learning not to get so lost in them that you forget what your goal is.
Author: Kelly McGonigal

Quote: This is what defines a willpower challenge: Part of you wants one thing, and another part of you wants something else. Or your present self wants one thing, but your future self would be better off if you did something else. When these two selves disagree, one version of us has to override the other. The part of you that wants to give in isn't bad--it simply has a different point of view on what matters most.
Author: Kelly McGonigal

Quote: Prayer needs no speech. It springs from the heart. Such worship or prayer is no flight of eloquence; it is no lip-homage. It must be combined with the utmost humility.
Author: Gandhi
Source: The Story of My Experiments with Truth: An Autobiography

Quote: If one ponders on objects of the sense, there springs attraction; from attraction grows desire, desire to flames to fierce passion, passion breeds recklessness; then the memory--all betrayed--lets noble purpose go, and saps the mind, till purpose, mind and man are all undone.
Author: Gandhi
Source: The Story of My Experiments with Truth: An Autobiography

Quote: We are not human beings having a spiritual experience. We are spiritual beings having a human experience.
Author: Teilhard de Chardin
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: We must not cease from exploration and the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we began and to know the place for the first time.
Author: T.S. Eliot
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: In emphatic listening, you listen with your ears, but you also, and more importantly, listen with your eyes and with your heart. You listen for feeling, for meaning. You listen for behavior. You use your right brain as well as your left. You sense, you intuit, you feel.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: We typically seek first to be understood. Most people do not listen with the intent to understand; they listen with the intent to reply. They're either speaking or preparing to speak. They're filtering everything through their own paradigms, reading their autobiography into other people's lives.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: The real key to your influence with me is your example, your actual conduct. Your character is constantly radiating, communicating.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: We have such a tendency to rush in, to fix things up with good advice. But we often fail to take the time to diagnose, to really, deeply understand the problem first. If I were to summarize in one sentence the single most important principle I have learned in the field of interpersonal relations, it would be this: Seek first to understand, then to be understood.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: One of the most important ways to manifest integrity is to be loyal to those who are not present. In doing so, we build the trust of those who are present. When you defend those who are absent, you retain the trust of those present.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: If you want to get something done, give it to a busy man.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: Between stimulus and response, man had the freedom to choose.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: We see the world, not as it is, but as we are conditioned to see it. When other people disagree with us, we immediately think something is wrong with them. But clearheaded people see things differently, each looking through the unique lens of experience.
Author: Stephen R. Covey
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: I know of no more encouraging fact than the unquestionable ability of man to elevate his life by conscious endeavor.
Author: Henry David Thoreau
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: It is impossible to for us to break the law. We can only break ourselves against the law.
Author: Cecil B. DeMille
Source: The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People

Quote: Turn their gaze away from Him towards themselves. Keep them watching their own minds and trying to produce feelings there by the action of their own wills. Teach them to estimate the value of each prayer by their success in producing the desired feeling.
Author: Screwtape (C.S. Lewis)

Quote: It's funny how mortals always picture us putting things into their minds: in reality our best work is done by keeping things out.
Author: Screwtape (C.S. Lewis)

Quote: I never met a man I didn't like.
Author: Will Rogers

Quote: A man is what he thinks about all day long.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: They conquer who believe they can. Do the thing you fear and death of fear is certain.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Whomever you help to build up and become a better, stronger, finer person will give you his undying devotion. Build up as many people as you can. Do it unselfishly. Do it because you like them and because you see possibilities in them. Do this and you will never lack for friends. You will always be well thought of. Build people up and love them genuinely. Do them good and their esteem and affection will flow back toward you.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: There is a deep tendency in human nature to become precisely like that which you habitually imagine yourself to be.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Throw your heart over the bar and your body will follow.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: Personally, I believe that prayer is a sending out of vibrations from one person to another and to God. All of the universe is in vibration. When you send out a prayer for another person, you employ the force inherent in a spiritual universe. You transport from yourself to the other person a sense of love, helpfulness, support--a sympathetic, powerful understanding--and in this process you awaken the vibrations in the universe through which God brings to pass the objectives prayed for.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: The conservation of energy depends on getting your personality speed synchronized with the rate of God's movement. God is in you. If you are going at one rate and God at another, you are tearing yourself apart. When we become attuned to God's rhythm, we develop a normal tempo within ourselves and energy flows freely.
Author: Norman Vincent Peale

Quote: The ideal Renaissance man is one who delights in learning for its own sake. The complete man, superior by virtue of his curiosity and the careful nurturing and harvesting of his gifts. A man who was modest and unassuming because he had no need to hide his thoughts or his deeds from others, nor had he the need to seek their approval.
Author: Bryce Courtenay

Quote: My mind was permanently focused on a single fixed point, the welterweight championship of the world. I thought about it so often, reaffirmed my determination so frequently, that hardly an hour of my life passed when it wasn't in my thoughts. I was seldom concerned with winning a particular fight; instead I was cultivating the habit of winning. Winning is a state of mind that embraces everything you do, so I found I won in other things as well.
Author: Bryce Courtenay

Quote: In this world there are very few things made from logic alone. It is illogical for a man to be too logical. Some things we must just let stand. The mystery is more important than any possible explanation. The searcher of truth must search with humanity. Ruthless logic is the sign of a limited mind. The truth can only add to the sum of what you know, while a harmless mystery left unexplored often adds to the meaning of life.
Author: Bryce Courtenay

Quote: Always listen to yourself. It is better to be wrong than simply to follow convention. If you are wrong, no matter, you have learned something and you will grow stronger. If you are right, you have taken another step toward a fulfilling life.
Author: Bryce Courtenay

Quote: Some of the best caregiving advice we've ever heard comes from flight attendants: ""Put on your own oxygen mask before assisting others.
Author: Randy Pausch

Quote: Go out and do for others what somebody did for you. My lifelong mentor, Andy van Dam, gave me wise counsel. He changed my life. I could never adequately pay him back, so I just have to pay it forward.
Author: Randy Pausch

Quote: Experience is what you get when you didn't get what you wanted.
Author: Randy Pausch

Quote: I slowly and deliberately opened a can of soda, turned it over, and poured it on the cloth seats in the back of the convertible. My message: People are more important than things.
Author: Randy Pausch

Quote: At each moment of a man's life he is either a king or a slave. As he surrenders to a wrong appetite, to any human weakness, he is a slave. As he day by day crushes out human weakness, he re-creates a new self from the sin and folly of his past--then he is a king. He is a king ruling with wisdom over himself.
Author: William George Jordan

Quote: Only a habit can subdue another habit.
Author: Og Mandino
Source: The Greatest Salesman in the World

Quote: When we have no need for one another; we can begin to love truly.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: What is a lizard compared with a stallion? Lust is a poor, weak, whimpering, whispering thing compared with that richness and energy of desire which will arise when lust has been killed.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: The sensualist begins by pursuing a real pleasure, though a small one. His sin is the less. But the time comes on when, though the pleasure becomes less and less and the craving fiercer and fiercer, and though he knows that joy can never come that way, yet he prefers to joy the mere fondling of unappeasable lust and would not have it taken from him. He'd fight to the death to keep it. He'd like well to be able to scratch; but even when he can scratch no more he'd rather itch than not.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Thirst was made for water; inquiry for truth.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: If we insist on keeping Hell (or even Earth) we shall not see Heaven: if we accept Heaven we shall not be able to retain even the smallest and most intimate souvenirs of Hell. I believe, to be sure, that any man who reaches Heaven will find that what he abandoned (even in plucking out his right eye) has not been lost: that the kernel of what he was really seeking even in his most depraved wishes will be there, beyond expectation.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Holiness is found in how we treat others, not in how we contemplate the cosmos.
Author: Terryl & Fiona Givens

Quote: What we may have thought was our private pathway to salvation, was intended all along as a collaborative enterprise, though we often miss the point. The confusion is understandable, since our current generation's preference for ""spirituality"" over ""religion"" is often a sleight of hand that confuses true discipleship with self-absorption.
Author: Terryl & Fiona Givens

Quote: Heaven is not a club we enter. Heaven is a state we obtain.
Author: Terryl & Fiona Givens

Quote: How much more meaningful is a life designed for spiritual formation, rather than spiritual evaluation.
Author: Terryl & Fiona Givens

Quote: In a culture increasingly obsessed with the rhetoric of choice and freedom, we resist the obvious.
Author: Terryl & Fiona Givens

Quote: Commandments are the expression of those eternal laws that will lead us to a condition of optimal joyfulness. They are the beacon lights of greater realities that define the cosmic streams in which we swim. Operating in harmony with those realities, as a swimmer who works with the current rather than against it, empowers and liberates us to fill the measure of our creation. We may ignore them in the illusion of utter self-sufficiency and independence. But we are then no more than a swimmer thrashing furiously, confidence of our powerful strokes, but swept along nevertheless, a captive of the prevailing tides.
Author: Terryl & Fiona Givens

Quote: Sympathy and sorrow, not anger and vengeance, are the emotions we must look to in order to plumb the nature of the divine response to sin. It is not the injured pride of a tyrant that we see here, but the pain of a suffering parent.
Author: Terryl & Fiona Givens

Quote: Legitimate guilt is to the spirit what the sharp protest of a twisted ankle is to the foot: its purpose is to hurt enough to stop you from crippling yourself further. Its function is to prevent more pain, not expand it. This kind of guilt comes from the light and beckons us to follow; its counterfeit takes us only deeper into the darkness of despair.
Author: Terryl & Fiona Givens

Quote: At least, there is neither a choir of heavenly heralds proving God exists, nor a laboratory of science equipment proving He doesn't. Rather, we find a persuasive body of evidence on both sides of life's competing propositions. Only in the case of us mortals, there is something to tip the scale. There is something to predispose us to a life of faith or a life of disbelief. We are truly free to choose belief or skepticism, faith or faithlessness.
Author: Terryl & Fiona Givens

Quote: You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something, sometime in your life.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: In the great battle of life, no brilliancy of intellect, no perfection of bodily development, will count when weighed in the balance against the assemblage of virtues, active and passive, of moral qualities which we group together under the name of character.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing, the next best thing is the wrong thing, and the worst thing you can do is nothing.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: Do not act as if thou wert going to live ten thousand years. Death hangs over thee. While thou livest, while it is in thy power, be Good.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: The difference between a hero and a coward is one step sideways.
Author: Gene Hackman

Quote: It is easier to build strong children than to repair broken men.
Author: Frederick Douglass

Quote: Shared joy is double joy. Shared sorrow is half sorrow.
Author: Brett McKay

Quote: Authentic happiness can only come from the long-term cultivation of wisdom, altruism, and compassion, and from the complete eradication of mental toxins, such as hatred, grasping, and ignorance.
Author: Matthieu Ricard

Quote: It's been said that success doesn't lead to happiness; happiness creates success.
Author: Carmine Gallo

Quote: People cannot inspire others unless and until they are inspired themselves.
Author: Carmine Gallo

Quote: With great teachers, the thing to me is of greater importance that the words; his deeds and life are more important to me than his talk, the gesture of his hand is more important to me than his opinions. Not in speech or thought do I regard him as a great man, but in his deeds and life.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: It seems to me that everything that exists is good--death as well as life, sin as well as holiness, wisdom as well as folly. Everything is necessary, everything needs only my agreement, my assent, my loving understanding; then all is well with me and nothing can harm me.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: Nobody finds salvation through teachings. That is why I am going on my way--not to seek another and better doctrine, for I know there is none, but to leave all doctrines and all teachers and to reach my goal alone--or die.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: Latter-day Saints are occasionally accused of being narrow-minded or unwilling to consider the beliefs of others. Such accusations may be true of Latter-day Saints who do not understand their own religion, but those who know the position of the church regarding the faith and beliefs of other people willingly allow them to ""worship how, where, or what they may"" (Article of Faith 11).
Author: Spencer J. Palmer

Quote: At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quote: Without faith there is no knowledge, without knowledge there is no virtuous conduct, without virtuous conduct there is no deliverance from self, without deliverance there is no perfection.
Author: Doctrine of Jainism

Quote: There are two ways to be fooled. One is to believe what isnâ€™t true; the other is to refuse to believe what is true.
Author: Soren Kierkegaard

Quote: The false suspicion that we can somehow be separated from God is the root of every form of anxiety.
Author: Eben Alexander

Quote:
My favorite concept of the book is that of a â€œpain-bodyâ€_x009d_. Every emotional pain we experience leaves behind a residue of pain that lives on in us. This accumulated pain is a negative energy field that occupies the body and mind. Itâ€™s the emotional pain-body. It has two modes of being: dormant and active. It may be dormant most of the time, but it can be triggered by certain situations that resonate with a pain pattern such as past moments of failure, loneliness, depression etc. 
 The natural reaction is to unconsciously identify with it. That is why it is so terrifying to start to feel depressed. It is the memory of the pain-body more than the current emotion. Depressed moods spur on all emotional memories of being depressed--causing a person to feel like they have always been depressed. Simply recognizing this truth (that the pain-body is a pseudo-self) allows acceptance of the depressed emotion, which brings peace. 
 The moment you observe it, feel its energy field within you, and take your attention into it. The identification is now broken and the higher dimension of consciousness of presence comes in. Refusing to identify with the pain-body by recognizing that it is not you, will allow the painful emotion to eventually subside as you â€œwatchâ€_x009d_ it, instead of festering and deepening.
Author: Summary - Zach Stanford

Quote: When there is no way out, there is still always a way through. So don't turn away from the pain. Face it. Feel it fully. Feel it--don't think about it!
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Compared to the peace of God, happiness is quite a shallow thing.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Once you master Presence, everybody you come in contact with will be touched by your presence and affected by the peace that you emanate, whether they are conscious of it or not. You teach through being, through demonstrating the peace of God. You become the ""light of the world,"" an emanation of pure consciousness, and so you eliminate suffering on the level of cause. You eliminate unconsciousness from the world.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Watch any plant or animal and let it teach you acceptance of what is, surrender to the Now. Let it teach you being. Let it teach you how to live and how to die, and how not to make living and dying into a problem.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: It is not true that the up cycle is good and the down cycle is bad, except in the mind's judgment. Growth is usually considered positive, but nothing can grow forever. The down cycle is absolutely essential for spiritual realization. Many illnesses are created through fighting against the cycles of low energy, which are vital for regeneration. There will be periods when you are highly active and creative, but there may also be times when everything seems stagnant--but you won't be identified with them!
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: When you find God in the present moment, you realize that you don't need to seek God. He is with you already.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: When listening to another person, don't just listen with your mind, listen with your whole body. Feel the energy field of your inner body as you listen. That takes away from thinking and creates a still space that enables you to truly listen without the mind interfering. You are giving the other person space--space to be. It is the most precious gift you can give.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Do not give all your attention away to the mind and the external world. By all means, focus on what you are doing, but feel the inner body at the same time whenever possible. It is almost as if you were reading with listening with your whole body. Stay rooted within.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: If you are drawn to an enlightened teacher, it is because there is already enough presence in you to recognize presence in another. Egos are drawn to bigger egos. Darkness cannot recognize light. Only light can recognize light.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: To listen to the silence, wherever you are, is an easy and direct way of becoming present. Even if there is noise, there is always some silence underneath and in between the sounds. Listening to the silence immediately creates a stillness inside you. Only the stillness in you can perceive the silence outside.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: To complain is always nonacceptance of what is. It invariably carries an unconscious negative charge.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: The psychological need to become anything other than who you are already should not be there. Being free of psychological time, you no longer pursue your goals with grim determination driven by fear, anger, discontent, or the need to become someone. You know that nothing real can be threatened.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Do not be concerned about the fruit of your action--just give attention to the action itself. The fruit will come of its own accord.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Forget about your life situation for a while and pay attention to your life.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: There is no salvation in time. You cannot be free in the future. Presence is the key to freedom, so you can only be free now.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Focus attention on the feeling inside you. Know that it is the pain-body. Accept that it is there. Donâ€™t think aboutâ€”donâ€™t let the feeling turn into thinking. Donâ€™t judge or analyze. Donâ€™t make an identity for yourself out of it. Stay present, and continue to be the observer of what is happening inside you. Become aware not only of the emotional pain but also of â€œthe one who observes,â€_x009d_ the silent watcher. This is the power of the Now, the power of your own conscious presence. Then see what happens next.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Whatever the present moment contains, accept it as if you had chosen it. Always work with it, not against it. Make it your friend and ally, not your enemy. This will miraculously transform your whole life.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Pleasure is always derived from something outside you, wheras joy arises from within. The very thing that gives you pleasure today will give you pain tomorrow, or it will leave you, so its absence will give you pain.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: The beginning of freedom is the realization that you are not the possessing entity--the thinker. Knowing this enables you to observe the entity. The moment you start watching the thinker, a higher level of consciousness becomes activated. You begin to realize that all the things that truly matter--beauty, love, creativity, joy, inner peace--arise from beyond the mind. You begin to awaken.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose.
Author: Bill Gates

Quote: Success is the result of what sociologists like to call ""accumulative advantage."" Because we so profoundly personalize success, we miss opportunties to life others onto the top rung.
Author: Malcom Gladwell

Quote: It's hard to think independently once you have heard the opinions of the institutional elite.
Author: Mitt Romney

Quote: There is nothing wrong with wanting to be the best in the world, as long as you remember that doing so also means wanting to be the best for the world.
Author: Keith Ferazzi

Quote: To this day, I face rejection on a regular basis. If you're going to be creative, cutting edge, out of the mainstream, you'd better get used to rockin' the boat. Passion keeps you going through the rough times come hell or high water, and both will come.
Author: Keith Ferazzi

Quote: Stop driving yourself--and everyone else--crazy thinking about how to make yourself successful. Start thinking about how you're going to make everyone around you successful.
Author: Keith Ferazzi

Quote: Every human is an opportunity to help and be helped.
Author: Keith Ferazzi

Quote: Selling is, reduced to its essence, solving another person's problems.
Author: Keith Ferazzi

Quote: A goal is a dream with a deadline.
Author: Keith Ferazzi

Quote: There is no such thing as a ""self-made"" man. We are made up of thousands of others. Everyone who has ever done a kind deed for us, or spoken one word of encouragement to us, has entered into the make-up of our character and of our thoughts, as well as our success.
Author: George Burton Adams

Quote: On the most profitable lie, the course of events presently lays a destructive tax.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: The reason why we feel one man's presence, and do not feel another's, is as simple as gravity. Truth is the summit of being; justice is the application of it to affairs. All individual natures stand in a scale, according to the purity of character in them.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: I think all Christians would agree with me if I said that though Christianity seems at first to be all about morality, all about duties and rules and guilt and virtue, yet it leads you on, out of that into something beyond: to a point where they are not thinking about it. They are too busy looking at the source from which it comes.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: If you have really handed yourself over to Him, it must follow that you are trying to obey Him. But trying in a new way, a less worried way. Not doing these things in order to be saved, but because he has begun to save you already. Not hoping to get to Heaven as a reward for your actions, but inevitably wanting to act in a certain way because a first faint gleam of Heaven is already inside of you.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Now Faith, is the art of holding on to things your reason has once accepted, in spite of your changing moods. Consequently one must train the habit of Faith, else he will just be a creature dithering to and fro, with his beliefs really dependent on the weather and the state of his digestion.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Most people, if they had really learned to look into their own hearts, would know that they do want, and want acutely, something that cannot be had in this world.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Aim at Heaven and you will get earth thrown in: aim at earth and you will get neither.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Do not waste time bothering whether you love your neighbor; act as if you did. As soon as we do this we find one of the great secrets. When you are behaving as if you loved someone, you will presently come to love him.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: We might thing that God wanted simply obedience to a set of rules: whereas He really wants people of a particular sort.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: The truth is that right actions done for the wrong reason do not help build the internal quality or character of virtue--but it is this character that really matters.
Author: C.S. Lewis

Quote: Pleasure is, and must remain, a side-effect or by-product, and is destroyed and spoiled to the degree to which it is made a goal in itself.
Author: Victor Frankl

Quote: Our current mental-hygeine philosophy stresses the idea that people ought to be happy, that unhappiness is a system of maladjustment. Such a value system might be responsible for the fact that the burden of unavoidable unhappiness is increased by unhappiness about being unhappy.
Author: Victor Frankl

Quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation--just think of an incurable disease such as inoperable cancer--we are challenged to change ourselves.
Author: Victor Frankl

Quote: Once the meaning of suffering had been revealed to us, we refused to minimize or alleviate the camp's tortures by ignoring them or harboring false illusions and entertaining artificial optimism. Suffering had become a task on which we did not want to turn our backs. We had realized its hidden opportunities for achievement.
Author: Victor Frankl

Quote: The last of the human freedoms--to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one's own way. Even under such circumstances, man can decide what shall become of him--mentally and spiritually.
Author: Victor Frankl

Quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
Author: Gandhi

Quote: Whenever people stop actively learning and growing, the clock has started ticking down to a time when they will no longer have anything left to give
Author: John C. Maxwell

Quote: I look for employees who are thoughtful of the ledger and mindful of the baby
Author: Stanley Marcus

Quote: Businesses thrive on agility, speed, passion, and alignment
Author: Forbes

Quote: The greatest leaders are the greatest followers.
Author: Elder Stephen Owen

Quote: In the Church of God, questions are honered, opposition is not.
Author: Elder Dallin H. Oaks

Quote: The most important single ingredient for success is knowing how to get along with people.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: I don’t want you to spend the rest of your life being average at what you are bad at. I want you to become great at what you are good at.
Author: Roy Spence

Quote: A prophet does not stand between you and the Savior. Rather, he stands beside you and points the way to the Savior
Author: Neil Anderson

Quote: If grass were to stiffen tall in an attempt to resist the strong winds, it would likely break in two. Be as free as the grass and flow with acceptance.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: What seems but trivial conversation to you may be of vast importance to another.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Optimism isn't a futuristic expectation that things will get better; it is embracing the present moment and loving what is.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Arrogance may cause you to appear more charismatic but it doesn't inspire trust.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: A life of too much ease and too much freedom will likely be reminisced with feelings of emptiness. Sacrifice and suffering give our lives substance.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: It is futile for a man to spend his days trying to find himself. If man's core is love, he will never truly find himself by looking inside himself. Love can only be actualized by giving it to another first.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: You can display all the confidence in the world without coming across as prideful if you make sure to show an equal amount of willingness and desire to learn from others.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Desiring to become a person of virtue tends to be a better motivator than trying to overcome your vices. As it goes, turning on the light is more effective than trying to push the darkness out.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Far too many fall into normalacy by forfeiting their independence of mind too soon. They let their church, their friends, and society mold them before ever finding out who they really are. Those who are great are not creations of others--they have created themselves.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Independent soul searching is prerequisite to passionate selfless ministry.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Before you can figuratively step into someone else's shoes, you must fully step out of your own. You can't experience true empathy if you are being biased by your own opinions and experience.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: Someone who stops speaking is not necessarily done talking. Interrupting a person's train of thought is just as rude as interrupting his voice.
Author: Zach Stanford

Quote: We must develop the capacity to see men not as they are at present but as they may become.
Author: Thomas S. Monson

Quote: Forgiveness comes from some other place. It's not something that we manufacture. We can create the conditions under which forgiveness can appear an we hope it will appear, but we can't control true forgiveness.
Author: Thomas Moore

Quote: Grant me the strength to accept things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.
Author: St. Francis

Quote: There is only one good, knowledge; there is only one evil, ignorance.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
Author: Socrates

Quote: The true intellectual is one whose intellect is sufficiently developed that he recognizes not only the great potential, but also the limitations of his intellectual capacity. The most learned people are those who find no inconsistency between study and faith and who have achieved proficiency in both.
Author: Rex E. Lee

Quote: Man has within him an inherent love of virtue and duty. To be sure, a man seeks some of the advantages of virtue. But one of the advantages of virtue is that it makes the soul superior to what an evil man calls advantages, and fills the heart with the love of God's law. There is no elevated mind that does not feel that virtue is it's own reward.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: To be sure, a man seeks some of the advantages of virtue. But one of the advantages of virtue is that it makes the soul superior to what an evil man calls advantages, and fills the heart with the love of God's law.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Loneliness is a time when we feel separate from all. Solitude is a time when we feel deeply connected to self
Author: Psychology Today

Quote: Truly happy people seem to have an intuitive grasp of the fact that sustained happiness is not just about doing things that you like. Happy people, are, simply put, curious.
Author: Psychology Today
